564255329.name: Great walk
564255329.author: a TripAdvisor user
564255329.reviewBody: What a beautiful park for me excelent, ilusions lake is so charming, the kids have lots of activities to do, is a must if you come to villahermosa.

561376692.name: A very pretty park!
561376692.author: a TripAdvisor user
561376692.reviewBody: A really nice park that sort of surrounds the Parque de la Venta. Great to stroll along the lagoon and watch for birds and other wild life.  Lots of people out enjoying it in the evening, with little carts selling food.

558131955.name: a bit of a surprise
558131955.author: a TripAdvisor user
558131955.reviewBody: We were simply walking around the town, between the Cathedral and the town center and we happened upon the park.  There are some vendors around, and it was around noon - so we spent an hour in the shade watching people, birds and the water........and a few gators!

556525871.name: Okay
556525871.author: a TripAdvisor user
556525871.reviewBody: While the park is peaceful and nicely laid out, there is a lot of plastic in the lake and many of the surrounding buildings appear empty and in disrepair. Why not pay somebody to go around and remove the plastic?  Would be easy to do.

552304692.name: A walk in the park
552304692.author: a TripAdvisor user
552304692.reviewBody: This is a nice park to stroll around. You are able to walk next to the lagoon and most likely you to see vendors from food to curiosities. It is a leisure, easy walk. I would recommend while on Villahermosa.

539534266.name: Careful, there are crocodiles in the laguna!
539534266.author: a TripAdvisor user
539534266.reviewBody: Free entry, with the Parque Museo La Venta set inside, next to the laguna. There you can see a collection of Olmec artifacts. Meanwhile, in PTGC, there are places to eat, drink and enjoy the day.

581816767.name: Incredible place
581816767.author: a TripAdvisor user
581816767.reviewBody: This park is beautiful, it is a mini jungle with loose animals that walk next to you, very fresh and my wife would love to come back with the children soon !! They should expand it more since the idea is very good!

325897008.name: Great Safari
325897008.author: a TripAdvisor user
325897008.reviewBody: We take a minibus very cheap to go there, and at the end of the day also took us and left us in the center of villahermosa. \nMore a safari than a zoo, you can finish the travel in half day. the park it\'s divided by biotas like african zone and jungle zone. \nWe arrived at a time of year with proliferation of mosquitoes, so take a good repelent.

address.streetAddress: Rancheria Las Barrancas s/n. a 17 Kms. de Villahermosa junto al aeropuerto

318768151.name: More like a safari than a zoo
318768151.author: a TripAdvisor user
318768151.reviewBody:
We paid 150 pesos for a taxi from Villahermosa to Yumka, where we paid 100 pesos per person for the entrance. You can take a colectivo back for only 15 or 20 pesos.

First the great stuff:
- Staff was very friendly (but didn't speak English).
- Elefants, rhinos, zebras, giraffes, gazelles, buffaloes, ostriches etc. had a BIG area and walked around amongst each other like they would do in Africa - I definitely liked this part and the animals looked happy. The monkeys had their own little 'island' but without fences. 
- The train/tram took us through this area and allowed great photo opportunities as we got close to many of the animals.
- The place where you get off the train has a big playground for kids, cages with snakes and a house of birds, where you can walk next to flamingoes, tucans and other exotic birds.

And now, the not so great stuff:
- We didn't see any manatees or crocodiles in the first area of the zoo. There weren't any hippos either.
- All the cats (pumas, tiger and jaguar) are kept in very small cages.
- We waited almost an hour for the train/tram to pick us up (staff said 20 minutes) and drive us through the savanna-part. We got off at a platform with snakes, birds and a playground and even though it was fun, we waited quite a while on the train before we could head back to the exit.
- Everything was in Spanish, no English options or written translations.
- There are a lot of mosquitos. I mean A LOT. Like, literally thousands of mosquitos on you all the time. Especially on the walking tour. Bring repellent! 

Although this may seem like a bad review, we actually had a great day and enjoyed it a lot. Most of the time it felt more like a safari than a zoo and I would recommend this to families with kids, animal lovers or if you have some time to kill in Villahermosa.

address.streetAddress: Rancheria Las Barrancas s/n. a 17 Kms. de Villahermosa junto al aeropuerto

304118129.name: Wild life
304118129.author: a TripAdvisor user
304118129.reviewBody: It\'s a familiar place, you visit it with your kids, friends, etc, you will have a contact with nature and you could see many and differents animals!

address.streetAddress: Rancheria Las Barrancas s/n. a 17 Kms. de Villahermosa junto al aeropuerto

281227842.name: Fun adventure
281227842.author: a TripAdvisor user
281227842.reviewBody:
This attraction is 15 minutes away from the city and just about 5 minutes from the airport. 
The tour is in Spanish so if you don't speak the language you will have to enjoy just a walk in nature sans explanation. 
The tour starts with a walk through the woods that leads you to a safari truck. This takes you around the zoo and drops you off at a spot where you can do several activities, shop for zoo memorabilia, use the restroom, etc. This is possibly fun for the kids, adults will need no longer than 30 minutes here - until you are able to catch the next bus. 
I enjoyed the zoo because I think its interesting to have some of these animals in the middle of the Tabasqueño jungle. I think its a very fun experience for a family with kids!

address.streetAddress: Rancheria Las Barrancas s/n. a 17 Kms. de Villahermosa junto al aeropuerto

278866811.name: A bit of a downer
278866811.author: a TripAdvisor user
278866811.reviewBody:
We enjoyed the walk in the jungle and saw several animals. It is in Spanish so we missed the explanations. 

A lot of the platforms were roped off so we didn't get to look for manatees or hippos for example. 

The ride on the tram was fine and he went slow and stopped once so people could take pictures. 

When we got to the major stop we enjoyed seeing the snakes and birds. There was an area for zip lining for larger children and adults. There was also an area for younger children to climb like a rock wall on the outside of a tree which my grandson enjoyed. He also went on the swinging bridge and rope walk but did not enjoy them as the person hooking up his safety rope jumped on both a lot while he was walking to knock him off. I'm sure the man thought he was helping him enjoy the event but he did not enjoy it and would have liked to experience them on his own. 

The wait at the stop was entirely too long as we had to wait for the next tram. 

We did not enjoy seeing the animals in cages other than the snakes and birds. I would rather they just have animals that they can allow to roam. 

We would not return or recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Rancheria Las Barrancas s/n. a 17 Kms. de Villahermosa junto al aeropuerto

253769652.name: Great "safari" style zoo
253769652.author: a TripAdvisor user
253769652.reviewBody: This safari-style zoo is definitely recommended: due to the size and nature of the grounds, you will get some great photos, and really get up close to the animals as you go round. Also includes a fun section with a few animals roaming loose and a few you can feed. Overall, a great day out. Just make sure that you take the number for a taxi firm, as transport to the place is sporadic.

214002223.author: a TripAdvisor user
214002223.reviewBody: Great little place to check out with the family. Many animals on site and a good place to check-out in Villahermosa.

address.streetAddress: Rancheria Las Barrancas s/n. a 17 Kms. de Villahermosa junto al aeropuerto

192606217.name: A must see if you\'re near
192606217.author: a TripAdvisor user
192606217.reviewBody:
We had a rainy day to fill (staying in Palenque) and decided to go to Villahermosa,  see the Parque Museo le Vente (closed when we got there) and Yumka. The drive took about 2 hours, one section of road was rough but even with the rain, the scenery was beautiful. Made a wrong turn in Villahermosa and ended up in a traffic jam which was a nightmare and the only way out was yo drive like a Mexican,  aggressively! 
Thank goodness we had Yumka to save the day. We were concerned it might be closed due to the weather, but it was open. We just happened to be the only visible clients at that time. The entrance fee was 60 pesos each, worth it. We were lucky to have our own private guide, Maritza, who could speak English very well. If there had been other clients the tour would have been in Spanish, of which very little knowledge.
We started on our own for a bit, saw some snakes and a tiger. Then Maritza took us further into the park, over some swing bridges, and showed us some deer, monkeys,  two pumas and a jaguar. We hoped to see a crocodile, but not in sight. Then we boarded a wagon pulled by a tractor, which took us around a large part of the compound where there were many more deer, gazelles, ostriches, water buffaloes, rhinos, monkeys, zebras, giraffes, yaks, a hippo that was in the water and an elephant who had gone down in a trench before we got near. There were many other animals as well. The only problem with this part of the tour was that the driver did not stop often enough for good pictures,  it's hard to get good shots when you are moving.
Apparently, there are also other areas where animals are kept as well as a boat on the lagoon and an orchid exhibit, but we felt it was too wet to do these things.
All in all, very much enjoyed this and highly recommended going there.

address.streetAddress: Rancheria Las Barrancas s/n. a 17 Kms. de Villahermosa junto al aeropuerto

186736815.name: Closed for renervations
186736815.author: a TripAdvisor user
186736815.reviewBody: My partner and I came a long way to see the Olmec heads at La Venta park and Yumka. \nBoth are closed. Very disappointed, especially because Yumka\'s website doesn\'t work and there is no other way to find out. Taxis as hotel management don\'t know that it\'s closed either.

address.streetAddress: Rancheria Las Barrancas s/n. a 17 Kms. de Villahermosa junto al aeropuerto

178656708.name: A great value.
178656708.author: a TripAdvisor user
178656708.reviewBody: A simple safari, but well worth the money... we will go back...\nIt was a great park for our family of six to go and spend some time together.

address.streetAddress: Rancheria Las Barrancas s/n. a 17 Kms. de Villahermosa junto al aeropuerto

150444624.name: Almost like being in Africa
150444624.author: a TripAdvisor user
150444624.reviewBody: Yumka offers a unique zoo experience unlike anything I have seen before.  No baren concrete enclosures and for a large part, no bars or cages (exept for the cats and some species of deer and monkeys on exhibit) and where there was confinment, it was in a more natural setting with large enclosures.  The tour is split half and half between a walking tour and a train ride (wagons pulled by tractor).  The tour is guided (in Spanish) but seeing the animals up close and personal needs no narration.  We chugged slowly through the grounds passing by many species including yaks, water buffalo, giraffs, rhino\'s, elephant, zebra\'s and more.  At times the train had to stop to let these animals pass.  It was as close to being in thier natural habitat as you can be.  Yumka is accessable by collectivo, taxi, tours or just driving.  We just stopped in on our way from Villahermosa to Palenque.  Entry is 60 pesos for adults and well worth the cost.  I wish we could have spent more time on this visit but it will certainly be on our list to visit again.

address.streetAddress: Rancheria Las Barrancas s/n. a 17 Kms. de Villahermosa junto al aeropuerto

140260869.name: Nature
140260869.author: a TripAdvisor user
140260869.reviewBody: I love Tabasco for it\'s nature and I also liked Yumka park, cause it is a very natural zoo. There animals live in a very special conditions, can be say that they are live on freedom. There are lots of iguanas, giraffe and elephant.. You can walk in a little part of the part yourself and you can go in a bus to selva.\n\nWill go there second time soon.

address.streetAddress: Rancheria Las Barrancas s/n. a 17 Kms. de Villahermosa junto al aeropuerto

672264400.name: Para un paseo muy en la ma\u00f1ana o ya entrada la tarde
672264400.author: a TripAdvisor user
672264400.reviewBody: Es punto de reuni\u00f3n para los que gustan de caminar un rato y ejercitarse, por lo regular hay mas movimiento en las tardes, mucha gente realizando caminatas... se permiten mascotas.. los domingos temprano es el punto de inicio de carreras, y es parte del paseo ciclista que termina ese d\u00eda hasta las 12.  Hay helader\u00edas, juegos, vendedores de raspados, cuenta con un \u00e1rea de Food trucks (en las tardes). Bueno para refrescarse un rato en las tardes calurosas de la capital tabasque\u00f1a..

670624752.name: Limpio, seguro, agradable, para todas edades y cerca de lugares para reponerte
670624752.author: a TripAdvisor user
670624752.reviewBody: Construido en el terreno que ocup\u00f3 la Feria. Amplio. Pasillos y \u00e1reas verdes en muy buen estado, ba\u00f1os, juegos infantiles, estacionamiento amplio que empieza a ser invadido por ambulantaje o que el gobierno municipal usa de bodega y oficinas m\u00f3viles. Hay algo de ambulantaje que invade pasillos para correr. Queda en el extremo norte de la Av. Paseo Tabasco que los domingos se cierra al tr\u00e1nsito vehicular.  Rodeado de excelentes lugares para comer y dos plazas comerciales. Hay tres hoteles muy buenos junto al parque.

646450394.name: Bell\u00edsimo para convivir en familia
646450394.author: a TripAdvisor user
646450394.reviewBody: Bellisimo parque con pista para correr o patinar, actividades al aire libre, una belleza para convivir en familia. Se encuentra en la mejor zona de Villahermosa, rodeado de Restaurantes y Hoteles de Primera

645240596.name: Buen lugar para ejercitarse tranquilamente
645240596.author: a TripAdvisor user
645240596.reviewBody: Si te gusta el ejercicio al aire libre, el Parque La Choca es una excelente opci\u00f3n para correr, caminar o pasear con tu perro. Es muy tranquilo y familiar. Est\u00e1 bien iluminado y siempre hay gente alrededor. Muy recomendable tambi\u00e9n para relajarse y disfrutar la tarde.

638466849.name: Un parque para pasar una tarde familiar
638466849.author: a TripAdvisor user
638466849.reviewBody: Tiene actividades para ni\u00f1os y j\u00f3venes, puedes caminar y tomar el fresco de la tarde, muchas personas aprovechan este hermoso parque para ejercitarse, tambi\u00e9n ofrece una serie de actividades, tanto deportivas como para aprender a educar a tu perro

633605806.name: Recreacion familiar y deporte
633605806.author: a TripAdvisor user
633605806.reviewBody: excelente lugar para ejercitarte con tu familia o pareja y al mismo tiempo disfrutar de la familia y con tus mejores amigos de 4 patas, es amplio, bonito, limpio permitiendote hacer diversas actividades deportivas y divertidas, ya que por las tardes lugare\u00f1os te ofrecen en renta actividades para los peques y alguno que otro adulto que se atreva a patinar o rentar un triciclo.

628274860.name: Bello lugar!
628274860.author: a TripAdvisor user
628274860.reviewBody: Un amplio sitio donde relajarse o ejercitarse de un modo ameno. Se encuentra en muy buenas condiciones (limpio, tranquilo  y muy bien cuidado) en una zona muy agradable.

625478095.name: Si te gusta hacer caminatas para ejercitarte, este es el sitio ideal
625478095.author: a TripAdvisor user
625478095.reviewBody: Este parque es uno de los mas concurridos por la poblaci\u00f3n, para realizar tus caminatas para ejercitarte, es un sitio agradable y muy visitado por lo que da la sensaci\u00f3n de seguridad al recorrer, no cuanta con muchos juegos mec\u00e1nicos para ni\u00f1os, pero si rentan carritos, triciclos y bricolan para entretenerlos.

621734374.name: Caminata
621734374.author: a TripAdvisor user
621734374.reviewBody: Muy buen lugar para caminar mucha vegetacion y lo mas interesante todo el a\u00f1o verde, puedes relajarte y despues de unas dos vueltas tomar una agua de coco.

602161538.name: Muy Agradable
602161538.author: a TripAdvisor user
602161538.reviewBody: Ir en las ma\u00f1anas a hacer ejercicio es de lo mejor que se puede hacer. Disfrutar de la Bici-Ruta, comer un helado, jugar Fut o Basket, algo para hacer de ma\u00f1ana si te encuentras en Villahermosa.

594716343.name: Excelente para una tarde de esparcimiento
594716343.author: a TripAdvisor user
594716343.reviewBody: Parque ubicado sobre Tabasco 2000, muchas \u00e1reas verdes, andadores para correr, trotar o caminar, fuentes, canchas deportivas, fuentes de sodas, snacks, teatro al aire libre, estacionamientos. Lo que se debe vigilar o prohibir es la cantidad de mascotas ( perros) que la gente lleva, ya que muchas mascotas no llevan correa y algunas son agresivas, otras defecan y sus due\u00f1os no limpian. En estos dos rubros deben ponerse las pilas las autoridades.

592777958.name: Vale la pena
592777958.author: a TripAdvisor user
592777958.reviewBody: Bello parque enclavado en la ciudad, con diferentes opciones, si quieres correr, jugar futbol, o alg\u00fan otro deporte, pasear andar en bicicleta, con lugares para tomar alg\u00fan helado, nieve, o refresco. Muy recomendable.

580642397.name: MUY BUEN PARQUE
580642397.author: a TripAdvisor user
580642397.reviewBody: Es uno de los lugares m\u00e1s espectaculares, asist\u00ed a un evento social en este lugar y fue de lo m\u00e1s reconfortante, recomiendo ampliamente  visite este lugar, no se arrepentir\u00e1, la vegetaci\u00f3n es excelente, vale la pena caminar y disfrutar al aire libre con la familia.

538844123.name: De los mejores lugares para correr en las ma\u00f1anas o caminar con tu mascota
538844123.author: a TripAdvisor user
538844123.reviewBody: Corro muy seguido en ese parque y cuenta con todas las caracter\u00edsticas para ser un lugar seguro para esta actividad.

530531787.name: Un momento de Relajacion
530531787.author: a TripAdvisor user
530531787.reviewBody: Si deseas un rato de relajacion, diversion para tus ni\u00f1os, caminar muy placidamente, este es un buen lugar, es muy tranquilo para andar en bicicleta, caminando, haciendo ejercicio, etc.

521923487.name: Una postal t\u00edpica tabasque\u00f1a en medio de la ciudad
521923487.author: a TripAdvisor user
521923487.reviewBody: Suelen ir a recrearse los ni\u00f1os familias y ciudadanos chocos a este parque tan bello, muy bien cuidado y con amplias zonas de juegos para recrearse o hacer ejercicio en la que fuera otrora recinto ferial .

517166320.name: Un mini Ed\u00e9n
517166320.author: a TripAdvisor user
517166320.reviewBody: Tabasco es un ed\u00e9n como dice lacanci\u00f3n y si cada rinc\u00f3n, parque, zoo es como si estuviera uno en una peque\u00f1a parte de la selva y este parque no deja de verse as\u00ed, ademas de contar con palmeras de extra\u00f1a forma las cuales comentan hab\u00edan sido un poco extintas debido a que hab\u00eda una plaga que se las acababa y ahora aqui iguen logrando que crezca, que bien y como todos los parque son tranquilos y relajantes.

511894372.name: Tranquilo y agradable
511894372.author: a TripAdvisor user
511894372.reviewBody: Lugar agradable y tranquilo en donde pasar una tarde en familia o amigos,  ideal para hacer ejercicio, andar en bici e ir de picnic

510746915.name: Excelente para caminar
510746915.author: a TripAdvisor user
510746915.reviewBody: Si quieres una tarde tranquila, caminar y ver el atardecer, este lugar es perfecto para llevar a tu familia

510313364.name: Lo disfrutar\u00e1s!!
510313364.author: a TripAdvisor user
510313364.reviewBody: S\u00faper bien ubicado en la Ciudad, es muy bonito, si lo tuyo lo tuyo es el deporte te encantar\u00e1 el parque, encuentras equipos de fuerza en la mitad del mismo, puedes correr o caminar sin ning\u00fan problema, por las ma\u00f1anas es mucho mas tranquilo para esto, en las tardes-noches puedes encontrar clubs para Ejercitarte desde Zumba, Tochito, cardio y un mont\u00f3n de cosas m\u00e1s... Eso si, si a tu como yo eso del deporte no es lo tuyo (jajaja) por las noches puedes darte una vuelta y lo amar\u00e1s!! en una esquina encontrar\u00e1s sus famosos Hot dogs!! Deliciosos!! tambi\u00e9n a la mitad del parque del lado de Tabasco 2000 Las marquesitas!! pidelas con quedo Bola!! las amar\u00e1s, si lo tuyo son los tacos, alitas, hamburguesas tienes que visitar el lado que esta pegado al Perif\u00e9rico!! ah\u00ed encontraras buenas opciones, pero si lo tuyo lo tuyo son los antojitos no te pierdas los esquites, chicharrones, frappes, horchatas de la catedral, uff!! que te encontrar\u00e1s mientras recorres el parque! \n\nDisfrutalo!!! oh!! y algo s\u00faper importante, muy seguro!! siempre encontrar\u00e1s Seguridad p\u00fablica ah\u00ed!!

631430653.name: Boring
631430653.author: a TripAdvisor user
631430653.reviewBody: Nothing worthy of time here other than a good acoustic. A very blah whitewashed cathedral. 2 side chapels with very tacky flashing lights surrounding the statues of Christ. \nDon\u2019t waste your time

617971265.name: Lovely architecture
617971265.author: a TripAdvisor user
617971265.reviewBody: The spires of this beautiful church can be seen throughout Villahermosa. Should I\nreturn to this city again, I\u2019d like to spend some time inside.

561376181.name: big church
561376181.author: a TripAdvisor user
561376181.reviewBody: I only drove by, so can only comment on the exterior, but it is a very noticeable landmark with its two towers.

558133389.name: Cool & Airy
558133389.author: a TripAdvisor user
558133389.reviewBody: This cathedral is rather interesting.  It is built more for function, than for style.  Follow around the right exterior, and you will find another building holding a tribute to the visit by Pope John-Paul II, including the chair & puppet made especially for the occasion, and the vestments that he wore (unfortunately, those photos did not turn out.......)

541243877.name: Went to Mass here
541243877.author: a TripAdvisor user
541243877.reviewBody: Went to mass here.  Church is very airy and open.  Had bats flying around during Mass, kinda of entertaining.  Waiting for Mass a man came out of a bible study class and gave us a history of the church very interesting.

539534952.name: A Nice Looking Cathedral
539534952.author: a TripAdvisor user
539534952.reviewBody: As any Cathedral in Mexico, the Catedral del Se\u00f1or de Tabasco is is a hangover from the days of Spanish colonialism. Also as with any cathedral in Mexico it is very nice to look at, set on a nice plaza where people go to spend the cooler hours of the day.

561376944.name: Good dinosaur skeletons
561376944.author: a TripAdvisor user
561376944.reviewBody: This is a nice natural history museum right beside the entrance to the Parque de la Venta.  The highlight is its collection of dinosaurs on display, including an imposing teradactly. But they have other exhibits on other animals and geology, etc.  Hey, admission was a whole dollar, so definitely worth it.

556524672.name: Nice
556524672.author: a TripAdvisor user
556524672.reviewBody: Nice little museum just outside the entrance to Museo La Venta. 20 peso entrance fee. Everything in Spanish but well laid out and interesting.

539536109.name: Another Reason To Visit
539536109.author: a TripAdvisor user
539536109.reviewBody: Another reason to visit the Parque Museo La Venta is that there is a natural history  museum right out front! What\'s more, the entry is combined with the ticket to La Venta, so you get two attractions for one price!

647807854.name: Excellent museum with great displays of Mayan & Olmec
647807854.author: a TripAdvisor user
647807854.reviewBody: Was an excellent museum, well displayed items and had some explanations available.  Although it was a Sunday with many visiting La Venta the museum was virtually empty.  Ate a the museum restaurant and was a good meal

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Antropologia Carlos Pellicer Camara

address.streetAddress: Periferico Carlos Pellicer Camara 511 Zona CICOM

632443418.name: Worth a visit!
632443418.author: a TripAdvisor user
632443418.reviewBody:
This well-presented museum is not too large, and can comfortably be visited in two hours or less.
The exhibits are described only in Spanish, but there are English language introductions and summaries on boards on the walls in several places. The exhibits all relate to the pre-Columbian history of the area.
The building is modern, bright and air conditioned throughout. The founder, Carlos Pellicer, has a detailed biography displayed on a wall in one of the rooms. There are nice river views from some of the upstairs windows.
All in all, a very pleasant way to pass an hour or two in Villahermosa.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Antropologia Carlos Pellicer Camara

address.streetAddress: Periferico Carlos Pellicer Camara 511 Zona CICOM

561377375.name: Great museum in a great building
561377375.author: a TripAdvisor user
561377375.reviewBody: A really great museum to learn about the Olmec and Maya cultures. They have the famous Maya stellae whose inscription that inspired all the "2012 will be the end of the world" nonsense.  But they have a lot more and I really enjoyed seeing the various artifacts, huge and small, and reading about them.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Antropologia Carlos Pellicer Camara

address.streetAddress: Periferico Carlos Pellicer Camara 511 Zona CICOM

551284184.name: Back to basis
551284184.author: a TripAdvisor user
551284184.reviewBody: This is a very important archeological museum of the region, with a good collection of Olmecs and Mayas. The museum has just been renewed therefore has a very good museography. Everybody should visit.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Antropologia Carlos Pellicer Camara

address.streetAddress: Periferico Carlos Pellicer Camara 511 Zona CICOM

463042572.name: Handsome small museum
463042572.author: a TripAdvisor user
463042572.reviewBody: Beautifully designed and well worth the visit. Camara was a very well known poet who wished to present the indigenous cultures to both the cultures themselves and the larger public.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Antropologia Carlos Pellicer Camara

address.streetAddress: Periferico Carlos Pellicer Camara 511 Zona CICOM

462476385.name: Well worth a visit
462476385.author: a TripAdvisor user
462476385.reviewBody:
The museum exceeded our expectations. My husband had wanted to skip it, having found regional museums disappointing in our recent travels. Walking towards this museum, he talked of how they are often in dusty buildings in need of repair. The collections can be unimpressive. 

What a treat to find the lovely Pellicer museum, with its well curated and well lit displays. The museum includes some amazing Mayan pieces, as good as works seen in other major collections of pre Columbian art such as Denver's art museum and D.C.'s Dumbarton Oaks.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Antropologia Carlos Pellicer Camara

address.streetAddress: Periferico Carlos Pellicer Camara 511 Zona CICOM

340533760.name: Fantastic museum.
340533760.author: a TripAdvisor user
340533760.reviewBody: The best museum we visited. Full of fabulous artefacts. Undergoing refurb on one floor when we visited but we managed to sneak into the closed floor which was truly amazing.very quiet there and not sure how many people make the effort to visit. Don\'t know what they are missing.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Antropologia Carlos Pellicer Camara

address.streetAddress: Periferico Carlos Pellicer Camara 511 Zona CICOM

340079062.name: New Anthropology Museum
340079062.author: a TripAdvisor user
340079062.reviewBody: It seems like this will be a great museum once completed. Nearly 2/3rds of the museum was closed when I visited, but what was available for viewing was well-exhibited and explained in both Spanish and English. I walked here from the historic downtown and it was a bit of a confusing trek through areas of town that did not look the best. There is no taxi service at the museum so you\'ll have to go out to the main street, a couple minutes walk away, to flag one down.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Antropologia Carlos Pellicer Camara

address.streetAddress: Periferico Carlos Pellicer Camara 511 Zona CICOM

339767377.name: One of the most important regional museums in Mexico
339767377.author: a TripAdvisor user
339767377.reviewBody: Make sure that they have finished the renovations.  During our visit, (December 2015) one third of the museum was closed.  The entrance was free because of the renovations; however, it is a pity to miss so much.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Antropologia Carlos Pellicer Camara

address.streetAddress: Periferico Carlos Pellicer Camara 511 Zona CICOM

294177452.name: its the end of the world as we know it....
294177452.author: a TripAdvisor user
294177452.reviewBody: There are literally hundreds of Olmec and Mayan artifacts carefully displayed on a number of levels. This is a modern museum, well laid out with not many visitors. We were staying with a local family so the guide who latched onto us was very pleased to see us and with the benefit of our friend translating were able to understand much about the place. The star exhibit is the original Mayan calendar predicting the end of the world recently. Actually there is much more to see and the items on the top floor were similar to other cultures around the world.\nIf you don\'t do culture there was good views of the river and cathedral and it\'s air conditioned!!

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Antropologia Carlos Pellicer Camara

address.streetAddress: Periferico Carlos Pellicer Camara 511 Zona CICOM

634501267.name: Fascinating building
634501267.author: a TripAdvisor user
634501267.reviewBody: This museum holds a collection of local history items.  But even more impressive is the building itself, which is covered inside and out with various tiles from Barcelona.  Some rooms have three different tile designs in them.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Historia de Tabasco (Casa de los Azulejos)

address.streetAddress: corner of 27 de Febrero and Av. Juarez

590287972.name: Worth a quick visit
590287972.author: a TripAdvisor user
590287972.reviewBody: An interesting place to learn about the area\'s history. The tiles alone are worth the visit. The staff were very sweet to us. Note that the signage is all in Spanish (this is NOT a complaint in any way) so if you don\'t have a grasp on the language, you might not get much out of it. The museum is small - I don\'t see most people taking more than an hour to see it.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Historia de Tabasco (Casa de los Azulejos)

address.streetAddress: corner of 27 de Febrero and Av. Juarez

558130602.name: If you are in the town center....
558130602.author: a TripAdvisor user
558130602.reviewBody: I was wondering around the town center, and took the time to stop here.  Although there is no english signage, most displays are not hard to understand.  The people were patient with me (I speak very little Spanish), and the price was about $1.50 (US).\nThe tile-work alone, seemed worth the entry.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Historia de Tabasco (Casa de los Azulejos)

address.streetAddress: corner of 27 de Febrero and Av. Juarez

556707995.name: Okay
556707995.author: a TripAdvisor user
556707995.reviewBody: Nice little museum with explanations in Spanish only. Not a lot to ie but the tiles are very nice. 15 or 20 minutes. Cost is 30 pesos.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Historia de Tabasco (Casa de los Azulejos)

address.streetAddress: corner of 27 de Febrero and Av. Juarez

481051385.name: Nice place to visit, do not expect too much..
481051385.author: a TripAdvisor user
481051385.reviewBody: Here you can see old stuff and it\'s book store too. \nYou can see mosaics on the floor and learn about Tabasco life style.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Historia de Tabasco (Casa de los Azulejos)

address.streetAddress: corner of 27 de Febrero and Av. Juarez

419301330.name: Doing Renovations
419301330.author: a TripAdvisor user
419301330.reviewBody: We didn\'t get the full tour due to renovations, but the building is especially fine.  We will look forward to seeing the interior on our next visit to Villahermosa!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Historia de Tabasco (Casa de los Azulejos)

address.streetAddress: corner of 27 de Febrero and Av. Juarez

340077335.name: Tabasco History Museum
340077335.author: a TripAdvisor user
340077335.reviewBody: Set right in the downtown historic center for convenient access and inside a beautiful colonial house with tiled walls. Great information about the state\'s history- not too overwhelming, not too little.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Historia de Tabasco (Casa de los Azulejos)

address.streetAddress: corner of 27 de Febrero and Av. Juarez

321931628.name: This is an historic site of Tabasco.
321931628.author: a TripAdvisor user
321931628.reviewBody: You can see old things and books, this site those in the downtown of Villahermosa, Tabasco. This bullding have twice floors an lobie.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Historia de Tabasco (Casa de los Azulejos)

address.streetAddress: corner of 27 de Febrero and Av. Juarez

281228051.name: Short, cultural experience
281228051.author: a TripAdvisor user
281228051.reviewBody: The visit to this colonial property is short and it makes a trip to the downtown area worth it. I did not take a tour but I believe that it would have added more meaning. The walls are beautiful and its historically very rich.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Historia de Tabasco (Casa de los Azulejos)

address.streetAddress: corner of 27 de Febrero and Av. Juarez

187959575.name: Worth a visit
187959575.author: a TripAdvisor user
187959575.reviewBody: Beautiful 19th century building filled with catalan tiles. Everywhere. Some rooms have different patterns on the same wall, floor. The museum has some interesting historical information about Tabasco since the Conquest. Due to its lack of precious minerals, the Spanish put their attention elsewhere -- hence today Tabasco still has a large indigenous population.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Historia de Tabasco (Casa de los Azulejos)

address.streetAddress: corner of 27 de Febrero and Av. Juarez

670625500.name: Centro interactivo para ni\u00f1os.
670625500.author: a TripAdvisor user
670625500.reviewBody: Es extensi\u00f3n o imitaci\u00f3n del Museo del Papalote. (en Tabasco le llaman papagayo al Papalote o cometa) Instalaciones modernas. Estacionamiento amplio seguro. Personal abundante y muy cort\u00e9s.  Muchos espacios para diversi\u00f3n educativa. Luce algo desperdiciado por la poblaci\u00f3n.  No saben que cuentan con este lugar de primera.

654637457.name: Agradable
654637457.author: a TripAdvisor user
654637457.reviewBody: Lugar agradable para pasar un d\u00eda divertido, ya no vi la cama de clavos que hab\u00eda antes sin embargo tiene cosas muy interesantes.

638595059.name: Un lugar recreativo y l\u00fadico, para ni\u00f1os y adultos
638595059.author: a TripAdvisor user
638595059.reviewBody: Es un excelente lugar para visitar en familia. los ni\u00f1os tienen a oportunidad de jugar y aprender, los adultos se pueden entretener y aprender. Para visitar en familia y disfrutar de nua tarde inolvidable

602162425.name: Nada especial
602162425.author: a TripAdvisor user
602162425.reviewBody: Como el resto de papagayos en el pais. Interactivo, entretenidos para ni\u00f1os, pero este, para acabarla est\u00e1 algo descuidado y las atracciones ya aburren despu\u00e9s de a\u00f1os que llevan sin renovaci\u00f3n.

600844238.name: Normal
600844238.author: a TripAdvisor user
600844238.reviewBody: Existen muchos experimentos fuera de funcionamiento. Pero la zonas que funcionan los chicos que est\u00e1n guiando muy atentos. Aunque ya no es muy divertido para j\u00f3venes  adolecen tes  es mas bien para ni\u00f1os m\u00e1s peque\u00f1os

595005399.name: Ilustrativo
595005399.author: a TripAdvisor user
595005399.reviewBody: Tiene muchas actividades id\u00f3neas para los ni\u00f1os, los "primos" muy atentos, el \u00fanico pero es la cafeter\u00eda inexistente

594355789.name: Visita con mi sobrina
594355789.author: a TripAdvisor user
594355789.reviewBody: El espacio denota un poco de descuido, por lo que sugiero que debe existir un poco mas de iluminaci\u00f3n, por otra parte, la ubicaci\u00f3n es un poco alejada del centro de la ciudad, los costos estan accesibles.

573966759.name: Desbravando Villahermosa
573966759.author: a TripAdvisor user
573966759.reviewBody: A mi me gust\u00f3 mucho el museo y las personas que trabajan all\u00ed. Yo recomiendo la visita para ni\u00f1os y adultos curiosos.

553405486.name: Entretenido
553405486.author: a TripAdvisor user
553405486.reviewBody: Es un buen lugar para llevar a tus ni\u00f1os, pues tiene much\u00edsimas actividades interesantes. Siempre hay alguien dispuesto ayudarte y a explicarte lo que necesites.

512865740.name: Una obra arquitect\u00f3nica sin igual
512865740.author: a TripAdvisor user
512865740.reviewBody: Una opci\u00f3n para que los ni\u00f1os pasen una experiencia \u00fanica donde puedan descubrir habilidades que le podr\u00e1n marcar la vida.

507891086.name: estaba en mantenimiento
507891086.author: a TripAdvisor user
507891086.reviewBody: pase tres meses en Villahermosa, vivia muy cerca del museo y no pude conocerlo. Tenia muchas expectativas para conocerlo y nada. Al parecer ya tiene mucho tiempo cerrado, Seria bueno que aligeraran su apertura al publico

506555971.name: Papagayo
506555971.author: a TripAdvisor user
506555971.reviewBody: Un buen sitio que visitar para variar de plazas comerciales, los ni\u00f1os se divierten y tambi\u00e9n encuentras diversi\u00f3n para los m\u00e1s grandes. La atenci\u00f3n por parte del personal es buena. La \u00faltima vez que fui se notaba que necesitaba mantenimiento.

638629945.name: Museo educativo
638629945.author: a TripAdvisor user
638629945.reviewBody: Es un museo peque\u00f1o con gran aporte educativo, ideal para visitar en familia y pasar un par de horas entretenido y aprendiendo

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Ruiz Cortines Parque Tomas Garrido

602543585.name: Muy buen lugar
602543585.author: a TripAdvisor user
602543585.reviewBody: Un buen lugar para visitar en fines de semana. Los recorridos que te ofrecen son muy completos y entretenidos. Buenas instalaciones, buena ubicaci\u00f3n, todo muy bien. Le falta algo de promoci\u00f3n, nada tan dif\u00edcil de solucionar.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Ruiz Cortines Parque Tomas Garrido

553405331.name: Los recorridos son buenos
553405331.author: a TripAdvisor user
553405331.reviewBody: Cuando fui con mis sobrinos la pasaron muy bien, el recorrido es educativo y vistoso, los ni\u00f1os no se aburren y hasta uno com adulto lo disfruta.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Ruiz Cortines Parque Tomas Garrido

532065932.name: Hermoso lugar
532065932.author: a TripAdvisor user
532065932.reviewBody: Desde que entras te da cuenta de lo mucho que puedes aprender, es muy peque\u00f1o pero muy entretenido para grandes y chicos, las explicaciones que dan son muy claras para cualquier edad, los ni\u00f1os se divierten a lo grande

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Ruiz Cortines Parque Tomas Garrido

510252223.name: Seras conciente de la beleza del planeta y de porque cuidarlo. Entender\u00e1s las etapas de la tierra.
510252223.author: a TripAdvisor user
510252223.reviewBody: Una visita breve pero sustanciosa, alta tecnolog\u00eda y mucho FUN.Solo hay unos pocos en america de este tipo. Conocelo\u00a1\u00a1\u00a1

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Ruiz Cortines Parque Tomas Garrido

365762470.name: Took My brother in law from Canada
365762470.author: a TripAdvisor user
365762470.reviewBody: Would like to mention how helpful the staff were when we were registering to the casino in order to play. Then we doubled our money excellent! You can still smoke there and you don\'t notice with the good exhaust fans. We had a great time.

557781600.name: Peque\u00f1o museo lleno de historia
557781600.author: a TripAdvisor user
557781600.reviewBody: Very interesting museum, you even get a free guided tour! \nInteresting enough, Carlos Pellicer never married his fianc\u00e9, presumably just too busy to form a family...

658912401.name: The Place is Closed
658912401.author: a TripAdvisor user
658912401.reviewBody:
On a regular Saturday, the place is simply closed.

I guess they just use it during special projections/events.

It is a pity since there is not much to do on the culture side in Villahermosa.

675337256.name: Lugar complicado...p\u00e9simo olor
675337256.author: a TripAdvisor user
675337256.reviewBody: Entrar y sali de ese lugar es bastante complicado, los accesos son mal\u00edsimos, peor las salidas, huele a ba\u00f1o, vil ca\u00f1o y ya por bastante tiempo, no se ve que hagan nada, se nota que es la administraci\u00f3n de el lugar por que muchos comercios brindan bastante buen servicio, solo por eso es que voy, mas por necesidad que por gusto, no se como no le han aprendido a plazas de otros lugares, donde lo que realmente importa es hacer un sitio placentero...de dar lastima

672288384.name: Plaza comercial moderna
672288384.author: a TripAdvisor user
672288384.reviewBody: En una plaza comercial muy grande, alberga tiendas como Liverpool, Palacio de Hierro, Sears, Sanborns y un sin fin de establecimientos y comercios. As\u00ed mismo tiene un Cinemex, se presta para entretener a toda la familia, hacer las compras que necesite, ropa, accesorios, lentes, juegos electr\u00f3nicos, una gran variedad de art\u00edculos y adem\u00e1s cuenta con \u00e1rea de comida r\u00e1pida, en el \u00e1rea mayor de la plaza hay caf\u00e9 y helado. y a un costado el \u00e1rea de restaurantes.

651857667.name: plaza comercial completa
651857667.author: a TripAdvisor user
651857667.reviewBody: puede encontrar una variedad de tiendas de todos los gustos, asi coomo de cine de diferentes salas, ademas de una variedad de alimentos en su zona gourmet y diferentes estilos de comidas desde especialidades como rapidas

645823839.name: Enorme
645823839.author: a TripAdvisor user
645823839.reviewBody: Grandissimo centro commerciale appena fuori Villahermosa. I negozi sono europei o statunitensi, prezzi nella media. Ottimo per passare un pomeriggio

638912275.name: Compras variadas
638912275.author: a TripAdvisor user
638912275.reviewBody: Podr\u00eda tener mas opciones para comer en restaurantes, pero tiene buenas opciones para aprovechar en familia.

638326436.name: Familyfriendly
638326436.author: a TripAdvisor user
638326436.reviewBody: Es un lugar grande y tienen muchas tiendas y restaurantes y a parte de comida r\u00e1pida, el entretenimiento son las compras y el cine, no s\u00e9 si es bueno para una cita.

605121645.name: Variedad en tiendas y restaurantes
605121645.author: a TripAdvisor user
605121645.reviewBody: Cuanta con una gran variedad de tiendas y la mayor\u00eda de los restaurantes cuentan con \u00e1rea para ni\u00f1os lo cual es muy agradable para ellos.

602534893.name: Depende cuando lo visites tu experiencia
602534893.author: a TripAdvisor user
602534893.reviewBody: Todo depende de cu\u00e1ndo vayas. Como es de lo mejorcito que hacer en Villahermosa, todos los fines de semana est\u00e1 abarrotado de locales. Ahora imag\u00ednate en Buen Fin y/o Navidad, no se puede ni caminar.

571495597.name: Visita con familia
571495597.author: a TripAdvisor user
571495597.reviewBody: Es un lugar muy seguro, existen lugares propios para la diversi\u00f3n de los m\u00e1s peque\u00f1os de la casa, por lo que es un lugar recomendable. De igual manera es un lugar accesible y c\u00e9ntrico.

564667535.name: tiendas departamentales, cines, cines VIP y lugares de juegos par ni\u00f1os
564667535.author: a TripAdvisor user
564667535.reviewBody: ir a altabrisa con la familia es muy divertido, ya que se encuentran restaurantes con \u00e1reas de bar para ver partidos, comer o tomar la copa, existe un \u00e1rea de comida r\u00e1pida ideal para que cada quien pida lo que quiere sin necesidad de entrar a un restaurante formal, est\u00e1n las dos mejores tiendas departamentales del pa\u00eds y hay rec\u00f3rcholis con un \u00e1rea bastante grande de juegos para los mas peque\u00f1os adem\u00e1s de un cine y esta un cl\u00ednica dental.

506533302.name: Altabrisa Villahermosa
506533302.author: a TripAdvisor user
506533302.reviewBody: Considerando el clima de Villahermosa la plaza es una excelente opci\u00f3n para pasar el rato puesto que suelen hacer eventos en la plaza. Cuenta con varias opciones de restaurantes, helader\u00edas, cafeter\u00edas y tiendas con distintos rangos de precios as\u00ed que es sencillo encontrar algo para la mayor\u00eda de bolsillos. Como punto negativo, actualmente solo cuenta con el cine como entretenimiento.

591287190.name: All locked up
591287190.author: a TripAdvisor user
591287190.reviewBody:
I was at the park this past Saturday morning ... 
I like towers and waterfalls, and was excited to get a bird's eye view of the city.
i got to the park about 11am found the tower without trouble and was VERY disappointed to find both entrances to the tower padlocked.

At night, yeah maybe, on weekdays ... ok maybe ...
but at 11AM on a Saturday .... 
somebody screwed up.

561378160.name: Tall observation tower
561378160.author: a TripAdvisor user
561378160.reviewBody: It\'s a tall observation tower overlooking the Lagoon of Illusions, and the lagoon is really a great place to spot different birds.

554313230.name: Nicr
554313230.author: a TripAdvisor user
554313230.reviewBody: Nice to take pics, but really busy area traffic is horrible people i meant drivers are rude so becareful when going and walking there

539535696.name: Maybe It Will Be Open
539535696.author: a TripAdvisor user
539535696.reviewBody: And maybe it won\'t, it\'s a crapshoot! For this reason, it is not the main attraction in the Parque Tomas Garrido Canabal (that would be the Parque Museo La Venta, right next to the mirador) and you shouldn\'t go there with the sole intention of getting a look across Villahermosa from the top, though the view is very nice. It\'s free to go up.

631429663.name: excelente lugar para tener un rato muy agradable
631429663.author: a TripAdvisor user
631429663.reviewBody: parque la polvora, lugar excelente para pasar un rato muy agradable, con tu pareja o familia, lugar para realizar todo tipo de ejercicios al aire libre, ya sea bicicleta, atletismo, sirve igual para acampar, cuenta con una laguna bonita, cuenta con subidas y bajadas... lugar muy bonito ... muy recomendable.

address.streetAddress: Av. Esperanza Iris S/N Col. Centro

604423430.name: De belleza inigualable
604423430.author: a TripAdvisor user
604423430.reviewBody: En este parque hay una laguna de belleza inigualable, un lugar apacible para ir a correr alrededor del lago o simplemente caminar, descansar y contemplar la naturaleza.

address.streetAddress: Av. Esperanza Iris S/N Col. Centro

602542151.name: Delincuencia al m\u00e1s no poder
602542151.author: a TripAdvisor user
602542151.reviewBody: Si eres Turista, definitivamente no vayas. A menos que quieras que te asalten. Esta bonito, se ve que en sus inicios era un excelente parque, pero actualmente descuidado y poco vigilado hacen de este el peor parque para pasar el rato o al menos uno de los peores.

address.streetAddress: Av. Esperanza Iris S/N Col. Centro

576966544.name: Excelente para uma caminhada
576966544.author: a TripAdvisor user
576966544.reviewBody: Um espa\u00e7o verde e calmo em meio ao caos da cidade ao redor, excelente espa\u00e7o para a pr\u00e1tica de atividades f\u00edsicas, por\u00e9m, \u00e9 preciso estar atento porque em alguns momentos pode ficar perigoso, pois haviam poucos guardas observando o local.

address.streetAddress: Av. Esperanza Iris S/N Col. Centro

530623720.name: Lindo, pero no es un must!
530623720.author: a TripAdvisor user
530623720.reviewBody: Ir al parque es agradable, pero no es una atracci\u00f3n imperdible. La ciudad se ha puesto peligrosa y yo les aconsejo que no vayan a este lugar por seguridad. En realidad mejor ni vayan a Villahermosa por el momento.

address.streetAddress: Av. Esperanza Iris S/N Col. Centro

511104175.name: Un pulm\u00f3n muy agradable en medio de la ciudad.
511104175.author: a TripAdvisor user
511104175.reviewBody: Ideal para ir a hacer ejercicio, caminar, hacer picnic o simplemente relajarse y leer un buen libro. Excelente opci\u00f3n.

address.streetAddress: Av. Esperanza Iris S/N Col. Centro

666106008.name: Lugar sencillo lleno de cultura escrita
666106008.author: a TripAdvisor user
666106008.reviewBody: Es una biblioteca mediana, tiene una gran variedad de t\u00edtulos de diferentes temas. Ideal para trabajos escolares, investigaci\u00f3n en general y buena lectura. De d\u00eda puedes disfrutar una lectura con la luz natural que pasa por sus grandes ventanales. La gente se comporta de maravilla, mucho silencio para estudiar, investigar y leer.

itemReviewed.name: Biblioteca Publica del Estado Jose Maria Pino Suarez

address.streetAddress: Av. Carlos Pellicer Camara No. 107 Zona CICOM

602542356.name: Gran variedad de libros
602542356.author: a TripAdvisor user
602542356.reviewBody: A pesar de que los ejemplares qu\u00e9 hay ah\u00ed son algo viejos, hay una gran vastedad de estos. No te la recomiendo si vienes por unos d\u00edas, pero si est\u00e1s aqu\u00ed por un largo periodo y no tienes nada que hacer, date la vuelta y ver\u00e1s que es interesante.

itemReviewed.name: Biblioteca Publica del Estado Jose Maria Pino Suarez

address.streetAddress: Av. Carlos Pellicer Camara No. 107 Zona CICOM

514878304.name: Tradici\u00f3n y sitio obligado para el estudiante
514878304.author: a TripAdvisor user
514878304.reviewBody: Dentro de una estructura arquitect\u00f3nica que marco \u00e9poca en Villa hermosa se encuentra este magnifico emblema del saber en nuestro estado, en el cual muchos estudiantes vivimos momentos de introspecci\u00f3n.

itemReviewed.name: Biblioteca Publica del Estado Jose Maria Pino Suarez

address.streetAddress: Av. Carlos Pellicer Camara No. 107 Zona CICOM

621311091.name: P\u00e9simo.
621311091.author: a TripAdvisor user
621311091.reviewBody: Quisieron darle un toque diferente al MUSEVI, sin embargo, termin\u00f3 siendo una decepci\u00f3n, ya que no se utiliza para nada, y ha resultado ser un punto fuerte para ser asaltados. Desgraciadamente nadie ha hecho nada por este inmueble, l\u00e1stima, puede ser una buena opci\u00f3n para negocios o mini ferias artesanales.

608204251.name: Monumental elefante blanco.
608204251.author: a TripAdvisor user
608204251.reviewBody: Una burla para los apaleados tabasque\u00f1os. Totalmente abandonado este sitio, herido por la corrosi\u00f3n y la corrupci\u00f3n. Id\u00f3neo ahora para la chela clandestina, para la cascarita de adolescentes. Al menos es un mirador digno hacia la Laguna de las Ilusiones. Las fuentes danzarinas han muerto tambi\u00e9n.

602157663.name: El Proyecto Futurista que simplemente no encaja en la Ciudad
602157663.author: a TripAdvisor user
602157663.reviewBody: Reci\u00e9n inaugurado fue muy bonito, pero actualmente, el Mega Proyecto de \u201cChucho Al\u00ed\u201d es nada m\u00e1s y nada menos una estructura de l\u00e1mina colgada. Donde pandillas por las noches se re\u00fanen para drogarse y/o asaltar a gente cerca. Actualmente no hay nada, una verdadera pena.

556344534.name: lo venden como museo
556344534.author: a TripAdvisor user
556344534.reviewBody: Originalmente trataron de hacerlo museo con cafeter\u00eda y todo, el descuido del lugar es impresionante, lo \u00fanico bueno que maneja es que sirve como puente y da buenas vistas de la laguna de las ilusiones.  \nno pasar en la noche esta muy solo.

548942096.name: estructura de lamina
548942096.author: a TripAdvisor user
548942096.reviewBody: Es algo raro ver esta estructura sobre una avenida, \nEn la parte superior dicen alguna vez hubo comercios.\nSus escaleras son demasiodo largas , nada recomendable para personas con problemas en las piernas. A mi parecer me parece un desperdicio de dinero  el haber construido esta estructura cuando hay zonas tur\u00edsticas que necesitan ser mejoradas.

532064054.name: una vista hermosa
532064054.author: a TripAdvisor user
532064054.reviewBody: A pesar de que muchos creen que es un solo puente peatonal, esto no es verdad. Tiene una vista hermosa y de noche puedes ver las aguas danzantes lo cual es precioso, mis hijos y yo nos divertimos mucho observando todo desde MUSEVI

517110508.name: Peque\u00f1o, pero bonito
517110508.author: a TripAdvisor user
517110508.reviewBody: aunque sirve como puente para cruzar de un lado al otro, es un Museo bonito con un estilo nuevo, no es muy grande, tiene esculturas en su mayoria y cafeterias aunque no es tan visitado.

512866525.name: Una obra maestra, un brazalete en paseo tabasco
512866525.author: a TripAdvisor user
512866525.reviewBody: Hay dichos a favor y otros en contra, pero esta obra fue galardonada y es sin duda una extraordinaria obra de arte, y en  el coraz\u00f3n de Villahermosa.

511895394.name: Mucho que desear
511895394.author: a TripAdvisor user
511895394.reviewBody: Aunque es una gran idea poner un museo con sus caracteristicas, no hay nada que ver en su interior. Antes podia ver uno las fuentes danzantes, sin embargo podria mejorar. El gobierno del estado deberia invertir en su mejora y que en verdad fuera un museo.

608686495.name: Comida deliciosa
608686495.author: a TripAdvisor user
608686495.reviewBody: Fui exclusivamente por la comida ya que me dijeron era econ\u00f3mica y con buen sabor y... efectivamente! La arrachera que ped\u00ed estaba riqu\u00edsima, con buen acompa\u00f1amiento. Mi amiga pidi\u00f3 una hamburguesa de arrachera igual de deliciosa y bien servida. Las bebidas gratuitas y rellenables. Los precios accesibles. Tienen buffet variado y de buen precio. El servicio es eficiente y de calidad. Regresar\u00eda y ahora si jugar\u00eda \ud83d\ude0b

address.streetAddress: Tabasco 2000, Los Rios Avenida Paseo Tabasco 4002

592778696.name: Divertido
592778696.author: a TripAdvisor user
592778696.reviewBody: Lugar divertido, buen servicio, excelente clima, amplio, seguro  y no te aburrir\u00e1s. Puedes saborear tu bebida favorita o degustar alg\u00fan platillo. Ah y de repente buenos premios.

address.streetAddress: Tabasco 2000, Los Rios Avenida Paseo Tabasco 4002

521929979.name: Juegos comida y buen servicio
521929979.author: a TripAdvisor user
521929979.reviewBody: Si te gustan los juegos de apuestas es sitio obligado,comida buen servicio al alcance de los bolsillos.

address.streetAddress: Tabasco 2000, Los Rios Avenida Paseo Tabasco 4002

602541972.name: Solo cosas interesantes durante la Feria
602541972.author: a TripAdvisor user
602541972.reviewBody: Si no vas en tiempos de Feria Tabasco no hay nada que hacer. Todo cerrado, descuidado, sin inter\u00e9s alguno. Pero si vas en Feria es una locura, si est\u00e1s como turista recomendable para que conozcas la cultura Tabasque\u00f1a.

530341771.name: Tristeza que solo se aproveche una vez al a\u00f1o
530341771.author: a TripAdvisor user
530341771.reviewBody: El parque es grande y se le podr\u00eda sacar mucho m\u00e1s provecho si se usara para mantener permanentemente actividades comerciales o culturales.\n\nEs una tristeza que desperdicien este parque us\u00e1ndolo solamente 1 vez al a\u00f1o y ocasionalmente para conciertos o palenques.

517112878.name: Es un paque perfecto para ni\u00f1os
517112878.author: a TripAdvisor user
517112878.reviewBody: Nada espectacular pero la convivencia ah\u00ed en familia esta muy bien , hay dirferentes opciones para todas las edades, aunque para los ni\u00f1os esta mucho mejor. y esta cercano a plazas comerciales y a restaurantes.

514879998.name: Un espacio que recibe los mejores eventos
514879998.author: a TripAdvisor user
514879998.reviewBody: La Feria Tabasco, Conciertos entre muchos otros eventos anidan en este centro de espect\u00e1culos, el cual esta adornado por la maravillosa flora tabasque\u00f1a.

631431012.name: visita al centro de convenciones con motivo de fiestas de diciembre
631431012.author: a TripAdvisor user
631431012.reviewBody: centro de convenciones tabasco 2000, ubicado en una de las zonas exclusivas de villahermosa, tab., cuenta con un amplio estacionamiento subterraneo, y con bastante espacio para mas de 5000 personas, lugar donde realizan eventos de feria y preferia, asi mismo realizan las tradicionales fiestas de diciembre de varias instituciones... buen lugar para tener demasiada gente.

602543412.name: Afortunadamente en remodelaciones
602543412.author: a TripAdvisor user
602543412.reviewBody: Eventos de todo tipo. Desde culturales con la Feria, hasta conferencias y exposiciones. La ubicaci\u00f3n inmejorable, pero el inmueble ya lucia algo da\u00f1ado y desgastado, que bueno que est\u00e9 en remodelaciones.

514882493.name: Los mejores eventos en Tabasco
514882493.author: a TripAdvisor user
514882493.reviewBody: Afortunadamente esta en proceso de reparaci\u00f3n, ha sido cuna de congresos, foros, y dem\u00e1s eventos de alto nivel, sin embargo la estructura estaba muy vieja.

631432713.name: estadio centenario 27 de febrero lugar tradicional para disfrutar beisboll
631432713.author: a TripAdvisor user
631432713.reviewBody: estadio de besibol centenario 27 de febrero casa de los olmecas de tabasco., lugar para disfrutar de un buen partido de besibol, ideal para ir con todos, ya sea tu pareja, esposa, familia o con quien tu quieras., se vende toda clase de alimentos y bebidas, vale la pena ir para desestresarse y gritar todo lo que quieras y no lo puedas hacer en tu casa o en tu oficina., jajajaa.... saludos.... no dejen de ir.

itemReviewed.name: Parque de Beisbol Centenario del 27 de Febrero

address.streetAddress: Avenida Velodromo de la Ciudad Deportiva S/N, Atasta, Primero de Mayo

568102912.name: Asco de lugar
568102912.author: a TripAdvisor user
568102912.reviewBody: P\u00e9simo lugar  mus mal cuidado, los asientos viejos y rotos, un ambiente de borrachos la gente no va a disfrutar el partido sino solo a embragarse. huele muy mal.

itemReviewed.name: Parque de Beisbol Centenario del 27 de Febrero

address.streetAddress: Avenida Velodromo de la Ciudad Deportiva S/N, Atasta, Primero de Mayo

514881839.name: Una tristeza que lo hayan dejado caer.
514881839.author: a TripAdvisor user
514881839.reviewBody: El beisbol es el deporte por excelencia de los tabasque\u00f1os, han dejado caer el estadio, falta de mantenimiento de inter\u00e9s por  parte de las autoridades, siendo que este sitio es adorado por los habitantes de la ciudad, ni hablar de los Olmecas que por falta de atencion de las autoridades ha ido en ca\u00edda.

itemReviewed.name: Parque de Beisbol Centenario del 27 de Febrero

address.streetAddress: Avenida Velodromo de la Ciudad Deportiva S/N, Atasta, Primero de Mayo

671001369.name: Pintoresco centro de la ciudad
671001369.author: a TripAdvisor user
671001369.reviewBody: Estuve solo una noche en Villahermosa y tuve oportunidad de recorrer su centro comercial e historico. Su plaza principal e iglesia es muy pintoresca para visitar, sobre todo de noche por la iluminaci\u00f3n.

629131427.name: Plaza de Armas
629131427.author: a TripAdvisor user
629131427.reviewBody: Centrem historick\u00e9ho m\u011bsta je Plaza de Armas s radnic\u00ed (kter\u00e1 m\u00e1 sm\u011brem od n\u00e1m\u011bst\u00ed modern\u00ed p\u0159\u00edstavbu) a kostelem Immaculata Concepcion (neposkvrn\u011bn\u00e9ho po\u010det\u00ed Panny Marie) na protilehl\u00e9 stran\u011b n\u00e1m\u011bst\u00ed, nejvy\u0161\u0161\u00edm soudem a \u0159adou dal\u0161\u00edch historick\u00fdch a nov\u00fdch budov, nedaleko je nov\u00e1 budova rozhledny.

602542796.name: Buen Lugar
602542796.author: a TripAdvisor user
602542796.reviewBody: Si eres Turista deber\u00edas ir, es un lugar en el que ver\u00e1s como es/fue Tabasco. Algunos Museos, el Malec\u00f3n cerca, algunos Restaurantes, Plaza de Armas, sin duda algo recomendable. Nadamas tengan cuidado, que a pesar de qu\u00e9 hay polic\u00eda es un sitio algo inseguro.

602094364.name: Lo han dejado decaer
602094364.author: a TripAdvisor user
602094364.reviewBody: Viv\u00ed en Villahermosa la mitad de mi vida, hasta los 20 a\u00f1os, y recuerdo que la zona luz era un lugar bonito, con construcciones antiguas y negocios tradicionales. Hoy, veo con tristeza que parece m\u00e1s a una central camionera, con negocios propios de una zona baja, mala comida en general, y muy pocas tradiciones. Para ser el centro hist\u00f3rico tiene muy poca historia. Lo \u00fanico que aplaudo son las carretas con productos de la regi\u00f3n, espero sigan con eso. Hace falta una m\u00f3dulo de informaci\u00f3n para turistas, que ayude a los visitantes cuando se encuentren por la zona, adem\u00e1s de la Profeco, porque sufrimos con un negocio de ropa de beb\u00e9 sonde hicimos una compra y nadie nos pudo ayudar.

598308632.name: Muy poco como para llamarle hist\u00f3rico, mucho para decirle centro.
598308632.author: a TripAdvisor user
598308632.reviewBody: Zona que podr\u00eda ser muy bella pero las costumbres locales lo impiden. Mucha basiura, ambulantaje sucio, pedig\u00fce\u00f1os por todos lados, bocinas en la v\u00eda p\u00fablica con ruido intenso, se percibe inseguro. Puestos de comida insalubres. En cuanto a "hist\u00f3rico" no hay nada que comentar pues todo es de \u00e9poca reciente. Hay una obra abandonada junto al r\u00edo. Ser\u00eda un bello malec\u00f3n pero los pol\u00edticos lo tronaron. En las locuras de un exgobernador taparon con un muro la vista al r\u00edo Grijalva. En el puente peatonal ver\u00e1s un mirador que no es mirador pues est\u00e1 cerrado desde hace a\u00f1os. Ver\u00e1s tambi\u00e9n con asombro como la gente prefiere pagar el cruce en lancha que usar el paso peatonal que esta ah\u00ed junto. Si observas el r\u00edo ver\u00e1s pasar flotando cientos de bolsas de basura o botellas de pl\u00e1stico. Una lastima. Si es una visita obligada pero no esperes gran cosa. Es el centro de Villahermosa y nada m\u00e1s, nada de historia y nada de cultura. Comercios por todos lados, eso si.\n

602542505.name: Algo peque\u00f1a
602542505.author: a TripAdvisor user
602542505.reviewBody: A comparaci\u00f3n con Altabrisa esta plaza es considerablemente m\u00e1s peque\u00f1a. Menos cosas por hacer, incluso luce algo vac\u00eda en algunos tramos. Si no tienes nada mejor que hacer ve a pasar el rato.

506564571.name: Galer\u00edas Tabasco
506564571.author: a TripAdvisor user
506564571.reviewBody: Lo que m\u00e1s me gusta es la vista de la zona de comida. Es uno de las principales plazas comerciales en Villahermosa, suelen hacer eventos culturales y exposiciones.

650194525.name: Must see
650194525.author: a TripAdvisor user
650194525.reviewBody: Parque Museo La Venta and the near by walkway along Laguna de los Ilusiones was the highlight of our short but pleasant visit to Villahermosa. The park is an open air museum and a zoo. The ticket office is open till 4pm however the park is open until 5pm. The open air museum has magnificent pieces of Toltec art, including famous warrior heads, altars and other sculptures. Don\u2019t miss to take a walk by the laguna afterwards. If you are passing by after hours you can see one of the heads from the walkway.

647807274.name: The best single place to see Olmec artifacts/sculptures
647807274.author: a TripAdvisor user
647807274.reviewBody: We had a great tour with our guide of this wonderful outdoor sculpture museum.  Enjoyed the animals/birds nearby esp. the jaguars

645600056.name: Walking in the past
645600056.author: a TripAdvisor user
645600056.reviewBody: I hard a quick visit of the park and Was astonished by the craft of the big Stone avvila le attivit\u00e0 the park. The re si a path simple ti follow by everyone of do not want to ha e a guide with you.

645397067.name: Park circuit
645397067.author: a TripAdvisor user
645397067.reviewBody: Recently my girlfriend and I were staying in Villahermosa and we did a day trip to this beautiful park.  The wildlife in the lagoon and all around was awesome. Great food vendors as well.  Lovely spot to spend a few hours.\n

645384348.name: Well presented archaeological museum
645384348.author: a TripAdvisor user
645384348.reviewBody: We skipped most of the zoo and went straight to the archaeological museum. It\'s all free to enter, and there was information in English and Spanish. Most of the major finds from the Olmec site of La Venta are nicely displayed on a winding walk through the jungle. It loses one point because it makes me sad that this site has to exist at all. These would be far more spectacular in their original setting, which was largely destroyed to build an oil refinery.

644630705.name: It was OK
644630705.author: a TripAdvisor user
644630705.reviewBody: The zoo area was quite small, some interesting animals but they had quite small enclosures, some of which were largely concrete - especially the big jaguars which needed much more space. There are some interesting sculptures, like the big heads. And some sculptures which barely resemble anything. Only 45 pesos entrance.

642385925.name: One of the best designed museums
642385925.author: a TripAdvisor user
642385925.reviewBody:
And with the perk of being a park and an amazing little zoo with the coolest jaguars and snakes. 
The sculptures exhibited in these gardens are superb and very well explained and displayed. 

Tejones will roam around you as you walk this beautiful park.

635586028.name: Zoo and Archaelogy
635586028.author: a TripAdvisor user
635586028.reviewBody: At first I wasn\'t excited about going and walking around in Villahermosa\'s heat, but our hosts encouraged me to go see this archaeological and zoological wonder.  One starts with local zoo animals, monkeys, birds, snakes, jaguars, crocodiles, and of course the ubiquitious coatis all over the grounds, then it gets into the Olmec culture with giant head carvings, tables, stelas, and more.  It is a flat path, with mostly even ground.  It is worth the trip and shady, so the heat won\'t melt you too fast.

634501008.name: Wonderful Olmec sculptures and zoo
634501008.author: a TripAdvisor user
634501008.reviewBody: This park is a combination of a musuem of Olmec history, a walking path with 33 Olmec sculptures spaced throughout, and a zoo of native animals.  The signage near each sculpture is in both English and Spanish.  Be sure to use bug spray before you enter!

630131113.name: Zoo ok
630131113.author: a TripAdvisor user
630131113.reviewBody: The zoo is ok, some of the animals are free in the zoo, we can enter in the birds\u2019 cage and be really close to them. The archeological tour is nice too but take products/spray against the mosquitos or the tour won\u2019t be this good !

604095610.name: 3 hours tour within the city
604095610.author: a TripAdvisor user
604095610.reviewBody: We always include some cultural visits in our holidays. This one offers a 2-3 hours outside walk trough the tropical forest, so great for teenagers and children. This combined with a small zoo!

602457182.name: HIghlight of visit to Villahermosa
602457182.author: a TripAdvisor user
602457182.reviewBody: To be in a park and have gigantic rock Olmec heads, statues, basalt tombs and mosaic floor tiles that date to hundreds of years BC is a humbling experience.  I enjoyed too the free-roaming coatis that crossed your path at sometimes surprising intervals, as well as the giant ceiba tree.  The aviary was quite interesting as well for the variety of colourful birds that could be observed.  This was unquestionably the most interesting and eye-opening activity I did in the Tabasco state capital.

590275121.name: Amazing!
590275121.author: a TripAdvisor user
590275121.reviewBody: My friend and I really enjoyed our stroll through this park. The Olmec heads and statues were just incredible and humbling!! Bring bug repellent!!

579218715.name: good experience
579218715.author: a TripAdvisor user
579218715.reviewBody: La Venta offered us a good view on the precolumbian area. We had a guide (otherwise you get few information, although there is some in English) and were drawn to quite some details, paid off this way.

575405358.name: Good Place
575405358.author: a TripAdvisor user
575405358.reviewBody: It was a fun visit especially the section with animals from the region. The archeological park (the actual ruins are someplace else) was mediocre, don\'t have very much information and feels abandoned. Apparently they have a light show at night during certain seasons, all the production materials are just hanging there.

570165184.name: Hold a Crocodile and Walk among wild Coatis.
570165184.author: a TripAdvisor user
570165184.reviewBody: My favorite part of the visit was the wild coatis that roam the grounds - the first time I\'ve ever seen them. I also greatly enjoyed the zoo, particularly the opportunity to hold a small crocodile, and see a black jaguar and hear it give a tremendous roar. The archaeological park, other than the huge Mayan head, which was fantastic, was kind of ho-hum for me.

569527666.name: great
569527666.author: a TripAdvisor user
569527666.reviewBody: Good place for a stroll, as you can walk in a tropical garden looking at relics. In the park you will encounter little mammals like racoons walking freely. They are lovely to watch. For the same reason food and bags are not allowed inside.

566484964.name: Interested
566484964.author: a TripAdvisor user
566484964.reviewBody: Spent the day walking around it was very interesting. Would love to go back again sometime. I think the cats could do with better living conditions

566383587.name: Nice display of prehistoric sculptures, great aviary.
566383587.author: a TripAdvisor user
566383587.reviewBody: This outdoor museum park has very easy trails leading to sculptures that each has interpretive signage. The zoo portion is also well-kept, and has a very nice walk-in large aviary.

565097129.name: Better than expected
565097129.author: a TripAdvisor user
565097129.reviewBody: We\u2019d had an extremely long drive having had to take a detour from San Cristobal to Palenque as local protesters, allied to the Zapatista movement, had blocked the main access road. This meant we missed seeing the Agua Azul waterfalls but actually our revised trip turned out better than expected.  This park in Villahermosa was really a diversion to stretch our legs and get some fresh air. What a lovely surprise it turned out to be. The Tabasco area was the centre for the Olmec civilisation (before Mayan & Aztec). An enlightened anthropologist, Carlos Pellicer saved many Olmec treasures in the 1950s that were threatened by nearby oil explorations. He installed them in a park and wanted to keep everything as near to nature as possible. You walk around the paths amongst the jungle like vegetation and suddenly come across a huge carved stone Olmec head, or an altar, or a statue, or even an animal enclosure. Wildlife and archaeology are intertwined which makes for a very interesting walk as you are always wondering what is round the next bend.

563114708.name: Visit it to get impression of Olmec culture
563114708.author: a TripAdvisor user
563114708.reviewBody: Actually there are two parts small Zoo and archaeological part with sculptures of Olmec culture (it dated 500-660 BC), it was another point to know Mexican ancient history and culture.\nIt was unexpected visit to this park (wasn\'t on our itinerary) so much thanks to our guide Jose.

561376400.name: Great display of Olmec heads and other artifacts
561376400.author: a TripAdvisor user
561376400.reviewBody: The park\'s display of the giant Olmec heads was my whole reason for coming to Villahermosa, and it didn\'t disappoint me.  The heads and other Olmec monuments here were really amazing.  The tomb constructed out of hexagonal basalt columns is one of the amazing things moved to this park.  \n\nI also really liked the aviary at the zoo and seeing the macaws flying around inside of it.

557831075.name: Interesting
557831075.author: a TripAdvisor user
557831075.reviewBody: A somewhat weird mixture of a zoo with archeological finds. I recommend to go on a guided tour. I didn\u2019t but I followed a group that was already in a middle of the tour, which made me appreciate how much I missed going by myself. \n\n

556525052.name: Great
556525052.author: a TripAdvisor user
556525052.reviewBody: Didn\u2019t care that much for the zoo part of the open air museum, but the statues are fantastic, spread along a circular pathway. The 40 peso entrance fee is well worth the money and saves a trip to the archeological site, as the best pieces are here or in Mexico City.

555966847.name: A walk on the wild side
555966847.author: a TripAdvisor user
555966847.reviewBody: A small zoo containing local animals combined with a number of large Olmec sculptures rescued from along the coast where the Olmecs used to live, all in a jungle setting.  There is a winding path that takes you around the animals and covered bird aviary and a second path with little red coloured right hand foot prints (why no left hand footprints?) every so often, that guides you around the artefacts.  The items are mainly massive stone heads with quite well defined features and there are descriptions in English by each item.  This is, so I am told, the only bit of jungle in Villahermosa and it is set right by the river\u2019s edge.  Will take about an hour or so to do both.

552307345.name: A walk through history
552307345.author: a TripAdvisor user
552307345.reviewBody: This is a must visit while in Villahermosa. You get to walk and see statues and famous big head from the Olmec Culture. Also, on the other side, you can see local animals. If you like history, you will enjoy this place.

541244250.name: Best place to go in Villahermosa
541244250.author: a TripAdvisor user
541244250.reviewBody: This place has the famous heads that everybody wants to see, but it is a very nice zoo.  Take a half day to see everything.

539529322.name: Olmec Culture
539529322.author: a TripAdvisor user
539529322.reviewBody:
Parque Museo La Venta is a really nice way to spend a day, set inside a much larger park on the Laguna De Ilusiones. It's full of interesting artifacts saved from the original Olmec city of La Venta close to the border with Veracruz. It is also home to a small zoological area with lots of alligators, birds, reptiles and mammals including a few of the big cats of the area.

It is easily accessible for people in wheelchairs and with strollers and very well priced at $50mn for non Mexicans. Just out the front of the entrance you'll find people selling cacao products as well as Tabasqueño artesanias amongst the touristy t shirts and refreshments.

When you finish here, it's easy to walk around to the laguna, where you'll find all sorts of other activities and places to explore, just watch out for the coatis, they're everywhere!

528607596.name: Amazing
528607596.author: a TripAdvisor user
528607596.reviewBody: The best place in the world to see olmeca artifacts. It contains some of the best olmec heads there are in the world. The animals are kept in very poor condition so it could be time to close down the zoo.

519197966.name: One of the most saddest places I\'ve ever been
519197966.author: a TripAdvisor user
519197966.reviewBody: It is a ruin, literally. The conservation of the archeological site is very poor, the are exhibiting some animals and by the look of them you get depressed. I hope this changes.

513418368.name: Horrible zoo
513418368.author: a TripAdvisor user
513418368.reviewBody: I was expecting a museum of Olmec culture but the site includes a horrible zoo where animals are kept in appalling conditions. Hope the zoo gets closed!

511580134.name: Go to real la venta as well!
511580134.author: a TripAdvisor user
511580134.reviewBody: I recommend going there right after 8:00 to avoid crowds. The had students/volounteer everywhere ready to explain to you the history - all of them were super nice and helpful. U definitely need a repelent, unless u want to be eaten alive by mosquitos. The vendors sell it right before the entrance, it helped a lot. We enjoyed the olmec statues, afterwords we went to real La venta and if u are a true history fan, it was a great experience, definitel worth the one and half our driving there. We didnt enjoy the zoo that much, seeing the jaguars and panthers in small spaces there was a sad thing.

500557407.name: Kids loved it. Adults? Not so much.
500557407.author: a TripAdvisor user
500557407.reviewBody: Its really under decay. Few animals, most of them miserable. Poor things. Tickets were really cheap, although the place sure does look old and without proper maintenance.

499783965.name: Fascinating, but lacking in atmosphere,
499783965.author: a TripAdvisor user
499783965.reviewBody: Parque Museo La Venta certainly has some positive aspects, the Olmec stonework being the most obvious and most impressive. Ancient sculptures are dispersed throughout the park, inviting one to speculate on the meaning and purpose behind the distinctive Olmec style and mysterious elements. Thankfully, there are placards next to each piece of art that attempt to explain them. Along with the archeological items on display here, there are also a great many animals of the region living in the park. As a preview to the jungles of Chiapas this zoo could be charming, but was a little sad after a few days in Municipio Palenque. Sure, it\'s great to see jaguars, snakes, exotic birds, monkeys, turtles, and peculiar ring-tailed long-nosed whatevers; but the park is in the midst of a bustling and noisy city. In one regard the experience here is exactly like the jungle; it\'s rampant with Mosquitos. All in all Parque Museo La Venta is worth the modest entrance fee, even if they charge extranjeros a little extra. Just remember that you will get eaten alive by Los insectos if you\'re not prepared.

497515083.name: INEXPENSIVE AND FUN
497515083.author: a TripAdvisor user
497515083.reviewBody: is a small park aldo is not a zoo it has animals living there is just next to the river and also has a good amount of birds , the main attraction are all the Olmec stone heads you will enjoy if you like history .\n\ndont forget to bring your bug spray , the cost of admission is about 2 dollars which is not bad at all considering all the things you can see there , also there is another museum right in front of la venta

496548689.name: Must see in Villahermosa
496548689.author: a TripAdvisor user
496548689.reviewBody: This is the place I grew up visiting when I lived in Villahermosa and I wanted to take my children there to see the same thing.  But I knew that many things I remembered to be great were not so great after coming back from the United States.  La Venta is still one of the best places to visit.
