You can see a few of the animals in the zoo section but the best experience is just walking around in the dense vegetation, admiring giant Ceibas, jumping over the ants, watching coati moms with their babies, etc. while admiring archaeological pieces of the Olmec culture.  The bad news is that there is only one colossal head there now, the "big one" was moved to La Venta, not the park but the actual site.  Also, the vendors outside the park offer a lot of cool art at prices way lower than in the Mayan areas.  If you have time, read all about "Papillon" the croc that everyone in Villa knows about that is dissected in La Venta, visit the museum of Natural Science right across the park, and walk along the lake at Parque Tomas Garrido. That is what locals do.

496358664.name: Now where else are you going to see Olmec heads?
496358664.author: a TripAdvisor user
496358664.reviewBody: This lovely park, in central Villahermosa, has a very nice walking path which takes you through dense city forest and displays a number of ancient OLMEC heads. There is some deterioration to these heads so you might want to see them before they are put into a sealed room and nobody enjoys them. This is part of a very large city park. A nice urban zone which includes an aviary.

491298037.name: Great place to visit!
491298037.author: a TripAdvisor user
491298037.reviewBody: Even though it\'s hotter than heck in Villahermosa this time of year, the park is shady and so it\'s tolerable. Adorable coatis wandering around sent my daughter into hysterics of joy, and the Olmec artifacts are fascinating. You follow paths in the jungle between them, which is fun. It\'s only $2 to enter and there\'s even a small zoo. It\'s very clean and you can buy very moderately priced souvenirs outside the park entrance. Definitely worth an hour or 2 (or as much as you can tolerate in the heat!)

482184380.name: Lovely place
482184380.author: a TripAdvisor user
482184380.reviewBody: Perfect combination between culture and fauna. Everything was made as in the wild nature. Easy round walk.

474307749.name: If you happen to be in Villahermosa
474307749.author: a TripAdvisor user
474307749.reviewBody: This sprawling outdoor museum is a wonderful place to pass a couple of hours if you happen to be in Villahermosa, although I wouldn\'t consider it a destination worthy of a special trip to an uninteresting city. We skipped the zoo in the park and focused on the well displayed collection of giant Olmec figures, heads and altars, which date back as mucjas 3,200 years.

466986008.name: Incredible energies in this oasis!
466986008.author: a TripAdvisor user
466986008.reviewBody: We have visited Parque La Venta over the years with our guides and friends, Jesus Ortiz and Miguel Angel Vergara. They shared lots of details about the site with us and we enjoy the tranquility whence you step inside the walls of the park. The fact is downtown makes it a perfect spot to go to after you have gone to other Olmeca sites in the area. The rascals otherwise known as Coatimundi are sweet and unfortunately love people food.

463045392.name: Outdoor Museum
463045392.author: a TripAdvisor user
463045392.reviewBody: This is a lovely walk-through permanent exhibit of monumental Olmec sculptures. maybe a kilometer. Not much in the way of directional signage and I wondered into the zoo by mistake. But the signage for the monuments themselves is both in English and Spanish. And the are wild little creatures going about their business. It was a worthy taxi ride from the historic section of town.

462472258.name: Beautiful garden
462472258.author: a TripAdvisor user
462472258.reviewBody: Well worth a visit. The Olmec sculptures are set in a lush garden. Coatis wander about. On our visit, we saw several groups of children on school trips to the park. Their laughter and high spirits added to what was already lovely place. \n\nOnly flaw I saw at the park was the sad sight of a pacing jaguar. The big cats at the park\'s zoo could use bigger and more interesting enclosures.

459535764.name: a must visit location, but take a guide as well.
459535764.author: a TripAdvisor user
459535764.reviewBody: The place is very near the hotels in town, a nice park as well, but the main issue with the La Venta Museum, is that you get to see parts of the Olmec civilization remnants, the huge heads, and it is worth taking one of the local guides, for very little money, you receive a far better explanation from what you can read in the monuments, it took almost two hours to walk all and understand it a bit better, as for the Zoo, it is a pity that they keep nice animals caged, they should look into improving it a lot  more...but totally worth visiting the site.

457202929.name: spectacular views of sculptures and birdlife
457202929.author: a TripAdvisor user
457202929.reviewBody: Very enjoyable walk around a beautiful park, lots of fauna and flora, exceptionally evocative Olmec and Mayan sculptures, a really good preparation for our trip into the southern classic Mayan sites.  Mayan culture came from somewhere!

454963800.name: Zoo, Aviary and Ancient Artifacts
454963800.author: a TripAdvisor user
454963800.reviewBody: I stopped in Villahermosa on my way to Palenque and was eager to revisit the park after 10 years. It has a zoo, aviary and ancient Olmec artifacts, all in a jungle-like setting. The Olmec civilization is the oldest in Mesoamerica and this collection is one of the best.  The play of light through the trees creates a special effect which you would not experience in a museum. There are two giant heads for which the Olmecs are famous along with figures holding objects in front of cave-like openings which could mark the intersection of the three realms of the universe. And there are many other sculptures and artifacts. While the zoo and the aviary require a facelift, the archaeological  park has not lost any of its special  quality.  Look out for the beautiful ceiba tree, sacred to the Mayans.

454156293.name: wonderful outdoor museum
454156293.author: a TripAdvisor user
454156293.reviewBody: wonderful day activity with lots of interesting artifacts.  The mosquitos were bad.  It was an easy walk for people with difficulty walking with lots of benches all along the way.  Very nice to have English translations under the spanish.  I was happy to see that there was a place to get water at the end of the walk because we were hot and thirsty.  The wild racoons were very interesting to see.

452348360.name: Nature and history
452348360.author: a TripAdvisor user
452348360.reviewBody: This is the best museum in Villahermosa. Is a pleasure to walk on the corridors watching the ancient Olmeca heads, plants and trees from Tabasco. The park is well maintained and clean. During the walk too much sweat because of the humidity, but is a worthy and amazing experience.

448375469.name: You must visit it
448375469.author: a TripAdvisor user
448375469.reviewBody: If you want to learn about the first Mesoamerican culture, the Olmecs, you  should visit it because you can see many  works and have and interesting explanation of the culture. The place is clean, humid, it takes 2 hours to walk and see the amazing works.

443352627.name: Nothing special
443352627.author: a TripAdvisor user
443352627.reviewBody: We visited this place after other cities in mexico and we wouldn t go there again. The animals are not treated perfectly. It is sad. The sculptures are good. But nothing special. + Full of moscito arround

437214323.name: Interesting
437214323.author: a TripAdvisor user
437214323.reviewBody: This was a nice park! I loved seeing the animals. They have lots of badgers but they are friendly. Kind of cool to be up close to them.

434670015.name: Wonderful place to visit and a breath of fresh air in Villahermosa - don\'t miss
434670015.author: a TripAdvisor user
434670015.reviewBody:
This place is something different and something that you should not miss if you are nearby.  If you're thinking of just passing through the town then I recommend you allow a few hours here instead (although the rest of the town is nothing special).

The entrance is at the north end.  I walked around almost the entire perimeter before finding this.out but it was a pleasant walk, especially the section alongside the lake near the tall viewing tower.

There were 2 things that stopped this place getting a 5* review.  One was the fact that the paths were roped off in such a way that you only had one route that you were forced along.  It ruined my enjoyment of the walk.  Number two was their pathetic effort at a zoo.  Its terrible.  I wouldn't say the animals looked mistreated at all but they were in very small cages, far to small for them to get any exercise and all the animals looked very very depressed and somewhat listless.  There were not many animals and many of the larger ones seemed to live alone.  There were a few empty cages too that looked like they'd been empty for some time.  The spider monkeys had just had babies though but they were in a deep enclosure and were hard to photograph easily,  Some of the smaller cats would be able to bite you if you were to put your hand onto the cage, nearly lost my camera and finger to an ocelot but that was my fault entirely.  

They won't let you take drinks in but the guard did look after mine at the gate.  Most of the walks are well shaded by trees.

Visit this place and see statues and carvings different from almost any others you can see in Mexico and preserved in excellent condition.

430354355.name: Very interesting
430354355.author: a TripAdvisor user
430354355.reviewBody: Possible to reach with public transport if you change in a city between La Venta and Villahermosa. Visiting this Olmec site was very interesting, and a nice breaking of monotony after visiting dozen or more Mayan sites. The earth-energy is strong in La venta. The Olmec heads and other scultptures are quite something. Meditate on the earth pyramid if you can. Apparently in the forest part of the park there may be some snakes which a guide that works there fears. He warned me about them but in the end we went and nothing happened. It is very worthwhile going there, especially if you are into symbology and ancient civilizations.

428186397.name: Don\'t miss when you visit Villahermosa
428186397.author: a TripAdvisor user
428186397.reviewBody: Loved this museum because it summarizes a taste of the state with a great storytelling: the history of the olmecas, the fauna, the rainforest representation in the middle if the city. Totally worth the visit!

424789105.name: Very Interesting
424789105.author: a TripAdvisor user
424789105.reviewBody: The Olmec artifacts that were moved from their original location to the Park are very different from other arquelogical sites I have seen in Mexico, which to me made the viist worth it.  They are laid out along along a marked trail in a natural setting which adds to the beauty and signs are in both English and spanish.  There is also zoo in the park filled with seemingly neurotic animals in too-small enclosures that you may want to skip.

419301168.name: Go..But Take the Repellent!!
419301168.author: a TripAdvisor user
419301168.reviewBody:
The trails are very well done, the sculptures are nicely displayed... the jungle setting is beautiful but they reeeeeely need to do some serious fumigation!  Clouds of mosquitoes that keep you moving along!  A park guy took us to a tree, plucked a few leaves and told us to crush them and rub anywhere we might get bit.  Allspice!  So fragrant...

There are a gazillion coatis, like a cross between a dog and a cat, begging food and creating a public nuisance.  They really need to do a spay and neuter program for the little beggars!

There are only three Heads left in the park, but lots and lots of other sculpture from La Venta.  Well worth the trip.  The Lagoon of Illusions is a beautiful local recreation spot, and you can walk its perimeter along the outside of the park.  We happened upon a local wedding there.

418639223.name: Good if you are in Villahermosa
418639223.author: a TripAdvisor user
418639223.reviewBody: The place is not a must see but if you are for any reason in Villahermosa, although there is really no reason to come here as a tourist, this is worth a visit. The museum has a nice open air collection of the Olmec architecture which you will not find anywhere else and is pretty interesting. At the same time there is a zoo, with a lot of animals, but I am wondering to what extent the animals can be happy in cages. the cages are quite big, so it is not the worst, but compared to what is done today  in European zoo trying to recreate well the habitat of the animal, this is far from it. There was even an injured raccoon and I hope they will take care of him soon.

416870602.name: Make the effort to visit
416870602.author: a TripAdvisor user
416870602.reviewBody: We just managed to get into this surprising park, as our plane was delayed from Mexico City, but our tour guide earned his money by making it happen for us.  We headed straight to see the heads of the Olmec civilisation and were immediately blown away.  Lots of the other ruins we had seen in Mexico were small and angular but these are so different and quite mesmerising.  Apart from the stones, there is a zoo but we arrived too late to see much of it.  Quite an eclectic mix of animals.  Take the time to visit and you will not be disappointed!\nThe ticket office closes at 4 but the park stays open until 5.

411759669.name: Exceptional statues in nice park
411759669.author: a TripAdvisor user
411759669.reviewBody: It was a beautiful experience to see the beautiful statues of the Olmec period outside in a park and not in a museum. The park itself is beautiful. Be aware of mosquitoes though. There are some animals to see but the cages were rather old and dirty. Villahermosa is not worth a visit but this park is.

410811025.name: Nature and history together
410811025.author: a TripAdvisor user
410811025.reviewBody: This park gathers the nature and the ancient culture: olmeca. It\'s in the center of Villahermosa city in Tabasco, where the olmecas are from. It\'s a non expesive activity if you\'re looking for a family recreation activitiy.

399775677.name: Amazing Olmec carvings
399775677.author: a TripAdvisor user
399775677.reviewBody: Great place to spend a couple of hours.  Small but nice zoo.  The highlight though was walking the paths through the park observing the numerous original Olmec carvings placed nicely throughout.  Explanation markers in Spanish and English by each piece.  Very interesting and helpful to understand what you\'re viewing.

398639285.name: A nice place to visit in the middle of the city.
398639285.author: a TripAdvisor user
398639285.reviewBody: I really enjoyed just walking around this labyrinth with great historical artefacts and animals to see.

381110119.name: Different and fascinating
381110119.author: a TripAdvisor user
381110119.reviewBody: Villahermosa is a lovely, modern city in the State of Tabasco in Mexico.  Just minutes from downtown is a park with shaded paths and mature trees.  Around every curve are huge Olmec heads and sculptures that have been unearthed in digs over the years.  The descriptive signs are in several languages and there are benches where one can just sit and look.  A fairy tale place.

379155316.name: Wow! Ulmec and Mayan artefacts
379155316.author: a TripAdvisor user
379155316.reviewBody: Beautiful setting alongside the lagoon and park the la Venta open air museum of sculptures is a must see if staying in the area of Villahermosa. The park is huge and tropical (wear your mossie cream just in case) but a delight to walk slowly around, taking in the vegetation alongside the sculptures - and if you are lucky like me, your own personal racoon for company. The sculptures are amazing - so old but so meaningful in 21st century too. And to have your own racoon posing alongside each one, unbidden but very willing, well what more can you ask for. When you have had enough of the sculptures then visit the zoo area which can be busier with people ( I saw no others on my sculpture walk) but is equally interesting. And the black jaguar - well that really epitomises Mexico1

372752674.name: No better place in Villahermosa
372752674.author: a TripAdvisor user
372752674.reviewBody: It\'s the most visited touristic spot in Villahermosa and deservedly so. It\'s a real pleasure to walk through this archeological park and see the big Olmec heads you otherwise won\'t see, unless you travel hundreds of kilometers westward.

369774930.name: Enjoyable
369774930.author: a TripAdvisor user
369774930.reviewBody: Really enjoyed this museum. It has a considerable variety fo animals. What mostly impressed me was the aviary, really beautiful. It really impressed me to see jaguars and panthers, which I hadn\'t even seen in Africa.\n\nYou must also see the 3M long cocrodile at the museum.

362542851.name: amazing
362542851.author: a TripAdvisor user
362542851.reviewBody: this is an amazing place to go take pictures with the exception of the mosquitos but i fell in love with this park

359917828.name: An outdoor museum, lovely
359917828.author: a TripAdvisor user
359917828.reviewBody: This is a well kept museum, the trails are easy and the attractions well presented, it is an interesting, good place to visit

358021715.name: Interesting park, but be careful with the mosquitos
358021715.author: a TripAdvisor user
358021715.reviewBody: This is an interesting park, but you have to be aware about mosquitos is a park in the middle of a jungle (jungle park) and the mosquitos in campeche are BAD, and I remember a mosquito vite that i got in the park that lasted more tan 3 months!, any way, the park is fantastic it has some interesing Maya and Olmec figures and is good place to walk and take photos.

357320525.name: An attractive archeological exhibit
357320525.author: a TripAdvisor user
357320525.reviewBody: I suggest avoiding Villahermosa (see my review of the city) unless you have a compelling reason to be there, such as an interest in the Olmec civilization and the huge monuments they carved from basalt nearly 2500 years ago. These fascinating edifices are attractively displayed amidst the jungle-like setting of La Venta (Parque Museo La Venta). The park\u2019s small zoological collection complements the tropical foliage, and a paved, level trail winds through the park with monuments attractively arranged along the way. Descriptions of each monument in English and Spanish inform the visitor about the monument\u2019s subject and approximate date of creation. We also visited Hacienda Jesus Maria, a working cacao farm just outside the city.

356435658.name: Great!
356435658.author: a TripAdvisor user
356435658.reviewBody: Really nice jungle setting, take water & moxie repellant. So much history in the 1km walk through. Great introduction to Tabasco.

353873535.name: Nice olmec heads, disappointing zoo
353873535.author: a TripAdvisor user
353873535.reviewBody: Most of the animals were not in their cages when we visited end of the day. The olmec head walk was interesting though, including english signs. After last entry time, you had 1 hour to finish your walk through the park.

352067641.name: Amazing
352067641.author: a TripAdvisor user
352067641.reviewBody: Very interesting and unique open air museum. A walk in the jungle. Get e a guide - it is much more interesting to hear about the history and context than walking alone. I did both

350636117.name: Great statues.  Sad zoo.
350636117.author: a TripAdvisor user
350636117.reviewBody: The walk on the path to the various Olmec stones is great. We walked from the Hyatt across the bridge along the lake which was also pleasant.  The zoo is a bit depressing as far as the felines and canines are. Still worth visiting for the various stones.

345253934.name: Unique Must-see
345253934.author: a TripAdvisor user
345253934.reviewBody: This park contains many Olmec statues placed in the same relation to each other as La Venta, where they were discovered. The plantings and trees evoke a jungle, though the paths are well-marked and easy to walk.  All this, plus "happy" animals in large spaces. The bird sanctuary is especially lovely.

344567097.name: A lovely day in a wonderful park
344567097.author: a TripAdvisor user
344567097.reviewBody: Where else are you going to see giant Olmec heads, an interesting zoo with some  beautiful jaguars (as large as lions!), and crazy little mammals walking around the grounds? Use a lot of insect repellant as I got a few bites despite having used it. They have a walk-in aviary I didn\'t get a chance to go into that looked very impressive.

344078694.name: Outstanding display of anchient ruins in a tasteful setting
344078694.author: a TripAdvisor user
344078694.reviewBody: Outstanding display of ancient ruins which were relocated from a marshy area where they drilled for oil. The settings are natural and very well done in a jungle park, complete with a small zoo of animals and historic displays. Very worthwhile

342142933.name: Jungle museum
342142933.author: a TripAdvisor user
342142933.reviewBody: Nice open air museum in the jungle with monkeys and coatis.  It\'s great to visit and there\'s a lot of shade coverage.  Wear insect repellent.  It\'s a nice stroll in the woods and the ruins are very nice.  Definitely worth the stop over.

340533133.name: Early morning visit
340533133.author: a TripAdvisor user
340533133.reviewBody: This us a must see in Villahermosa. We arrived early morning. It was lovely and quiet. We came to visit the sculpture park which was as fantastic as we had hoped it would be. Beautiful setting, lots of animals darting about in the foliage including an armadillo!\nThe main attraction is the Olmec heads. Just fantastic.

340204791.name: A lovely day!
340204791.author: a TripAdvisor user
340204791.reviewBody: Parque La Venta is a good reason, perhaps the only one, to visit Villahermosa. We spent the better part of the day wandering along the lagoon, enjoying the zoo and the archeological park. Although it is in the city it is a true jungle where we saw a wild toucan. The zoo focuses on animals of the region and houses them humanely. If that weren\'t enough, the display of large Olmec sculptures along a winding path in the jungle is just magical.

340076085.name: Outdoor museum/zoo/park
340076085.author: a TripAdvisor user
340076085.reviewBody: The museum exhibit at the beginning, under the thatched roof, gives a good overview of La Venta arqueological site\'s history and the transport of the stone relics from there to this park. The zoo portion is small and you feel sad for the animals in small, dingy, very hot cages! The walking trail portion to see all the stones relics is relaxingly set in the jungle, it seems like you aren\'t even in the city. It is super hot and humid there in Villahermosa so be prepared for that and also bring bug repellent. The best part is the free-roaming coatimundis everywhere! They are so cute and not afraid of humans. I also came up-close to an ant-eater that descended from a tree to snack while I was walking by!

339766293.name: Nice open museum with amazing ancient pieces on display
339766293.author: a TripAdvisor user
339766293.reviewBody: A park a museum and a zoo in the same place.  A must if you visit Tabasco state.  It includes large pre-hispanic pieces relocated from archeological sites.

339073957.name: Something to do
339073957.author: a TripAdvisor user
339073957.reviewBody: It\'s more like a zoo than a museum. Not much else to do in Villahermosa so it is good place to spend a couple of hours, see some poor locked-up animals and learn a little about the oldest civilization in Latin America.

338610320.name: Olmec museum in a park and zoo
338610320.author: a TripAdvisor user
338610320.reviewBody: Wonderful setting to see these Olmec statues. Many mosquitos so be aware. Not so keen on the caged animals

337937354.name: Definitely worth the visit
337937354.author: a TripAdvisor user
337937354.reviewBody: Very nice way to combine a zoo with a little bit of archaeology. Apparently their night show (it was 12/31 so it was not open that night) is worth seeing. Allow 2-3 hours for a complete visit at a leisurely pace.

337902135.name: Nice Park
337902135.author: a TripAdvisor user
337902135.reviewBody: Nice park in Villahermosa. Not a destination park, but it\'s a decent walk with nice pre-hispanic sculptures in case you are already in Villlahermosa

335253213.name: Great Olmeca museum
335253213.author: a TripAdvisor user
335253213.reviewBody: Nature, History and Beauty are togheter in this place, full of smells and views that will be difficult to forget, dint miss it

333929125.name: Interesting... Besides the mosquitos
333929125.author: a TripAdvisor user
333929125.reviewBody:
An interesting walk in a trail surrounded with local vegetation that has both ancient stone sculptures and a mini wild-animal display. From this, the Jaguars and spider monkeys are the most interesting. 
The huge human heads, altars and human-animal figures carved in stone are amazing, especially considering the time when they were made and the tools their makers had. 
Another fauna in plentifulness is the hundreds of very-hungry-for-blood mosquitos. They were very good in finding the spots in our bodies without bug repellent, and the attacks strengthened when stopping to take pictures. Well, it goes with the region and this type of park. 
Very inexpensive entrance by the way.

330404941.name: Olmec Statues from La Venta
330404941.author: a TripAdvisor user
330404941.reviewBody: Fabulous display of monumental Olmec pieces moved in the 1950\'s from their endangered location by Carlos Pellicer. Setting & wildlife exhibits are an added plus.

328795640.name: Well done archelogical park with decent zoo for kids
328795640.author: a TripAdvisor user
328795640.reviewBody: We overnighted here to see the Olmeca heads. The park is well done and was not crowded. Signage  was adequate. My son liked the zoo. Free parking.

324263766.name: Buy a insect repellent before
324263766.author: a TripAdvisor user
324263766.reviewBody: Just before buy a repellent there\'s a lot of mosquitos ! you can buy one in the main entrance is just like $20 pesos or is better buy one in a supermarket o drugstore

322086886.name: The Olmec cultures place typical of souteast M\u00e9xico in Villahermosa
322086886.author: a TripAdvisor user
322086886.reviewBody: A nice place introductory for a wider visit to the region near the downtown of  Villahermosa, close to the river and a walking in the open air museum, with shops inside of typical handcrafts

321945106.name: Amazing Park Museum
321945106.author: a TripAdvisor user
321945106.reviewBody: This is beatutiful site, start in part site of park there are animals, jaguars, eagles, spiders, briths, snake, and en second part this museum outdoor, the colosal pices, and it\'s posible huking in the woods, it\'s an aventure. There are mosquitoes, and crocodiles. And end in the park.

321738043.name: Great place to visit.
321738043.author: a TripAdvisor user
321738043.reviewBody: I went with my dad when I was a kid and I had the pleasure to come 40 years latter and still amazing, super recomended place to visit amazing sculptures.

306155576.name: Olmec Head In The Mist
306155576.author: a TripAdvisor user
306155576.reviewBody: If you want to catch the iconic Olmec Heads of  Mexico do go visit and get a taste of some of their cultural heritage. Full of nifty sprites and adventure. Make sure not to spend to nuch money with the street  peddlers who always have wonderful trinkets to entice you !!!

304119336.name: If you like history, this place is for you!
304119336.author: a TripAdvisor user
304119336.reviewBody: You\'ll know the Olmec culture and see the legacy they left the people of southeast Mexico. You can also see and buy crafts from the region.

299381611.name: Excellent museum/park!!!
299381611.author: a TripAdvisor user
299381611.reviewBody: I like that the museum is also part of the park, sorrounded by regional flora and fauna. People should wear comfortable clothes because it can be really hot and humid. The pieces from the Olmec culture are so beautiful and interesting. There\'s a magical night light show inside the museum.You can take a walk in the park after visiting the museum. Don\'t miss it!!!

296468794.name: Mix of experiences
296468794.author: a TripAdvisor user
296468794.reviewBody: I must say this place is right in the heart of Villahermosa, next to a big lagoon. First you have the zoo section, which could be better kept but has many reptiles and birds. Then the archaeological part has almost 40 Olmec sculptures. They are really impressive and each has a good description in both English and Spanish. You can take pictures with some of the animals like birds and crocodiles. \n\nDebi decir que la venta se encuentra en el coraz\u00f3n de Villahermosa, junto a una laguna.  Primero est\u00e1 la parte del zool\u00f3gico, que podr\u00eda estar mejor mantenida pero tiene muchas especies de reptiles y aves.  Despu\u00e9s, la parte arqueol\u00f3gica est\u00e1 compuesta por casi 40 esculturas Olmecas. Son muy impresionantes y cada una tiene descripciones tanto en ingl\u00e9s como en espa\u00f1ol. Puedes tambi\u00e9n tomarte fotograf\u00edas con algunos animales como aves y cocodrilos.

295360622.name: Interesting place
295360622.author: a TripAdvisor user
295360622.reviewBody: That park is must see in Villahermosa as is its main attraction)\nIt has a lot of ancient sculptors and nature is beautiful.. you can try typical comida de Tabasco and see HUGE CROCODILIES ))\nIt very humid and hot there so don\'t forget to bring a bottle of water.

294171046.name: If you are here...go
294171046.author: a TripAdvisor user
294171046.reviewBody: Interesting zoo / museum / park in Villahermosa.  It is a real mixture of experiences. You are in the middle of the city yet it is like you are walking in the rainforest with coatis roaming freely around you. The Olmec heads are incredible works of art / construction. Some of the animal compounds are better maintained than others, the giant aviary was the highlight for me.  The city is not a tourist destination but if you are passing through it is well worth a visit.

290282964.name: The only "must" in Villahermosa
290282964.author: a TripAdvisor user
290282964.reviewBody: A total of 36 large stone sculptures from the original La Venta archaeological site, were brought in 1958 to this park and museum by poet Carlos Pellicer, to protect them. This park, in the middle of the city, keeps the surrounding of the jungle where the original sculptures stood.  Moreover, it includes a zoo that provides the ambiance for a magnificent itinerary through the history of the Olmeca.

281943410.name: A must see in Mexico
281943410.author: a TripAdvisor user
281943410.reviewBody: I\'ve visited this open-air museum several times over the years and it appears improved each time I am there.  The zoo portion has been expanded and there were some new, larger enclosures.  Some of the older ones are quite run down.  There were quite a few new animals exhibited.  Be aware that there will be lots of animals roaming the area where you are walking.  \nThe Olmec heads and stones are impressive and worth a visit all by themselves.  They have uncovered them which makes them easier to see and photograph although probably adds to their deterioration.

278371802.name: Unmissable if you are in the area
278371802.author: a TripAdvisor user
278371802.reviewBody: We had an unexpected 4-hour wait for a bus at Villahermosa Airport so teamed up with another couple and shared a taxi to the national park La Venta (about 20 minutes away). Anyone interested in Mexican archaeology and history should see this gem of a place: the high spots are of course the giant Olmec stone heads placed strategically around in the jungle setting. You will need a couple of hours...but well worth the small entrance charge (half price for seniors). Read up about it if you have the time before you visit, or hire a guide or headphones at  the gate. Excellent.

271447656.name: Fun family visit
271447656.author: a TripAdvisor user
271447656.reviewBody: A fantastic walk where you\'ll discover:\nExotic local animals who make the day fascinating; on the weekends the staff would let kids see/touch some of them.\nYou will discover interesting replicas of the Olmeca sculptures, a culture from ancient local people (before the Mayans era).

270965776.name: super opportunity to learn to know the olmeca culture
270965776.author: a TripAdvisor user
270965776.reviewBody: you cannot stay even for a short time in Villhermosa without visiting the parc and museum La Venta. From the petrol zone of La Venta, 120 km away, about 50 sculptures have been transported to the 7 square km. parc created by the supervision of the famous poet Carlos Pellicer.\nthe parc is a real tropical jungle environement with a circuit\nto discover nature, animales and several fenomenal colosal heads, some weighting 30 tons.

270907280.name: The Olmec history in 30 minutes
270907280.author: a TripAdvisor user
270907280.reviewBody:
Master pieces of Olmec artefacts displayed in a jungle park in the middle of the city...
The site is interesting as you can see the big heads (only 10 worldwide, 3 of them are in the park) but there is a lack of explanation.
the site is  surrounded by a lake and be aware of mosquitos. The really bite !

261424582.name: A pleasant hour.
261424582.author: a TripAdvisor user
261424582.reviewBody: Entry fee is only $40 pesos and its a pleasant way to spend an hour or so. We enjoyed the history of the Olmec statues and liked that the desciptions were in both English and Spanish.  It was fun to see little wild lemurs running about even if they were raiding the trash bins!\nThe \'zoo\' animals are bit sad looking and as other reviews I agree they could benefit from more water but I\'m sure many visitors enjoy this section of the park. \nP.S.Wear bug repellent!

259951556.name: Not really worth the journey
259951556.author: a TripAdvisor user
259951556.reviewBody: Being interested in Olmec culture were visited. It was good to see the heads. The animals were a bit of a waste of time and not relevant!

257123415.name: Interesting place to spend an afternoon
257123415.author: a TripAdvisor user
257123415.reviewBody: The park combined a zoo of sorts with a historical park. Most of the artifacts were from or replicates from the actual La Vents archeological site, which is located out of town, and they were all presented well with signage in English and Spanish. The animals were all a little bit sad, but it was fun to see the 4 jaguars up close.\nFor the 40 peso entrance fee for foreigners, it was a very nice place to get some steps in.

255581397.name: An interesting stop while in Villahermosa
255581397.author: a TripAdvisor user
255581397.reviewBody: This is a combination zoo, park and archeological site in Villahermosa.  The Mayan & Olmec statues and exhibits have been taken from many locations in the Tabasco and  Chiapas areas.

254177732.name: Great place
254177732.author: a TripAdvisor user
254177732.reviewBody: This is a beautiful little park in the middle of the city. There is a a walking path that takes you around the park so that you can see the Olmec heads and other sculptures that were moved from the site of La Venta. There are many types of birds and other wildlife that live in the park that borders on a large lake.  If I lived here I would walk here everyday.

253309421.name: Museo La venta Park
253309421.author: a TripAdvisor user
253309421.reviewBody: La Venta is the famous park in the city of Villahermosa. Everywhere in the park you can admire the famous gigantic Olmec heads. It surely is an unforgettable experience! The park itself is also a beautiful place, because of its settings in a jungle-like park. You can see monkeys and other little animals being around and also at the little zoo, as well as an interesting museum. Truly a must in Villahermosa!

252334780.name: It\'s worth it
252334780.author: a TripAdvisor user
252334780.reviewBody: This park has really important pieces of the Olmec\'s history. It also has a huge area where you can see a variarity of animals in their habitat from the state of Tabasco. Thia is a muat If you go to Villahermosa.

248173683.name: Nice historical park
248173683.author: a TripAdvisor user
248173683.reviewBody: The zoo part of the park is nothing special, but the museum of prehistoric man is very good. There are not many museums I have been to that explain the history of Olmecs.  The colosal heads are beautiful and worth the trip by themselves.

247212160.name: It\'s s must see
247212160.author: a TripAdvisor user
247212160.reviewBody: This a beautiful park-museum. Evertything is outside. The colosal heads of The olmecs are beautiful.\nThe walk is beautiful in the middle of a lots of trees.\nTake comfortable shoes. And a camara because there are lots of animals to see.

241337930.name: Abobinable, disgraceful, embarrassing...
241337930.author: a TripAdvisor user
241337930.reviewBody:
1) one of the otter's pen had very little water left.  The other otter had diarrhea with again, very little water left.

2). The racoon was so weak, he could barely stand on his own.  There was less than a 1gallon bucket of water left in his pen!

3) one of the 3 badgers has an injury to his back legs and had difficulties walking.

4) the state of the black panthera was very sad.  When it started walking toward us, it came to about couple feet away.  It's abdomen is so swollen, it looked like it had a bunch of tumors in it.  It walked with difficulties.

We went in @ 3:30PM and felt we should have enough time to visit until park closes @ 5PM. There were 2 areas where @ 4PM the access was not allowed.  Staff there were too busy chatting among themselves & decided to tell us as we walked by....' Sorry area es cerrado"!!!  When we challenged the fact that we knew it was closing @ 5PM... They just kept repeating the same thing.  We were so upset with what we saw and what we experienced, we walked out of there and promised never to come back.  Bob Barker was upset about an elephant in captivity in an Edmonton, Alberta Zoo...and managed to get it removed from there.... This entire La Venta Park should be closed down and have the animals transferred somewhere they can afford to look after them and really want to care for them!

241264159.name: great tribute to OLMEC civilization
241264159.author: a TripAdvisor user
241264159.reviewBody: although the monuments displayed are not in their original location, the are presented with a great respect and admiration, for a merely researched civilization, with a great respect and admiration.\nthe whole park is very well designed , and perfectly maintained, with clear route and explanations, the gardening is perfect, and everything is calm, and displays majestic. salute to mexico heritage.

240873790.name: Nice place to see if you are in Villahermosa
240873790.author: a TripAdvisor user
240873790.reviewBody: Liked the animals in natural habitats.  Didn\'t have as much time there as we would have liked.  We did see one of the crocidiles swimming in local lake---scary!!!

240769037.name: Great Olmec stone sculptures, small zoo
240769037.author: a TripAdvisor user
240769037.reviewBody: The park is a contribution of Mexican poet Carlos Pellicer who bought the original site of these Olmec sculptures in Tabasco to save them from the oil companies that were drilling the area. The sculptures were rescued and put in exhibition in this park, downtown Villahermosa. The sculptures are a rich source of information and art from this ancient culture. The park is also a small zoo with few species: jaguars, crocodiles, turtles, birds and some other small jungle species. Good to stroll with children.

240391759.name: Outstanding BioPark
240391759.author: a TripAdvisor user
240391759.reviewBody: This park has three caged Jaguars that are spectacular.  It is sad that they are caged and look very bored but you can get three feet from them for some great photos.  The rest of the park has very well preserved stone carved figures from the Olmec culture that were saved from destruction during oil extraction activities in Tabasco state.  Worth the two hours that it takes to tour the site.

238471835.name: Varied museum
238471835.author: a TripAdvisor user
238471835.reviewBody: Ok so like many museums they have picked the artefacts up from another part of the country and placed them all in one place.  Whilst it probably would have been better for them to be kept in their native surroundings, it would have also meant that tourists would have been plodding over the native surroundings and the objects may have been spoiled or at risk of being stolen and otherwise many fewer people would have been able to see these wonderful artefacts.  However this is a very varied and interesting museum, there are indoor aspects and outdoor aspects around the park.  They have placed artefacts from historical times in a park on a trial for you to navigate the park and view the artefacts.  The park grounds are well kept and has wooden bridges, domed hut, plants and flowers and various other vegetation.  There are also wild and unusual animals roaming around.  In addition to this the park also has a zoo which is a bit more disappointing, there are plenty of variety of animals but I don\'t like seeing them locked up in cages and some of the cages were not well kept.  There was a brilliant aviary though and uniquely you could walk around inside the aviary which was a brilliant experience, there was a pathway with bridges and water and you could mix with the birds inside.  Overall a very nice experience.

237140055.name: There is not much to see.  It\'s OK for a nice stroll outdoors on a weekend, but that is all.
237140055.author: a TripAdvisor user
237140055.reviewBody: Forget about impressive or variety of animals.  There is hardly a petty crocodile in a dirty pound.  \n\nIt makes up for a nice stroll through the greenery.  The entrance fee is very low - $3.

236568036.name: Culture and animals
236568036.author: a TripAdvisor user
236568036.reviewBody: Nice bit of culture about the Omecs (sculptures) in a park-like walking tour. The signs also explain in English what is on show. Also some animals to be seen. It doesn\'t take long to view, maximum 2 hours.

235893796.name: Culture and Nature
235893796.author: a TripAdvisor user
235893796.reviewBody: The Olmec heads are well displayed in lovely surroundings.  The zoo provided an opportunity to see jaguars and rare tropical birds up close, even if they are behind bars.  The jaguars were magnificent, and the toucan and other tropical birds were great.

227735474.name: Culture and Nature most alive
227735474.author: a TripAdvisor user
227735474.reviewBody: You feel you are in the real tropical world where the Olmec developed this magnificent civilisation.

222310518.name: Must visit, but in need of major investment
222310518.author: a TripAdvisor user
222310518.reviewBody: My rating is based on the cultural significance of the Parque and not its actual condition.  Given the significance of the Olmec heads, I was troubled by the condition of the park and the way in which these priceless treasures were displayed.  It rained (of course) while I was there and that can make the walking path slippery and necesitate caution.  To get the most out of the Parque, I recommend paying one of the licensed tour guides as the lack of signage inhibits a proper self-guided tour. Also, I\'d forgo the souvenirs outside and buy them from the tourist store in the main mall if possible. (They did have better shot glasses, though)  But if you must, do haggle.

216486435.name: Tragic to see captured jaguars.
216486435.author: a TripAdvisor user
216486435.reviewBody: As the title of this review says. It\'s very tragic to see captured jaguars just for stupid tourists to take photos of. Especially since the Olmecas regarded the Jaguar as a God. I came a long way to finally see the Olmeca heads and I don\'t regret coming but I think it\'s a disgrace to have the heads on display in this Zoo. They should move them back to where they found them. As for Villahermosa, it\'s without a doubt the most boring city in Mexico. Go to Chiapas instead people.

214002311.name: loved it here
214002311.author: a TripAdvisor user
214002311.reviewBody: loved it here, although the heads are most likely all replicas.they do have some cool animals on site, would recommend this place because its just a good fun time and walk around the campus can be enjoyable!

208492846.name: Boiling Hot
208492846.author: a TripAdvisor user
208492846.reviewBody: The Olmec heads are awesome, the sad part is seeing the caged animals. The heat makes it difficult to enjoy seeing all of the carvings. I spent about an hour here and got out, not much more to do here.

202688496.name: Decaying park
202688496.author: a TripAdvisor user
202688496.reviewBody: The zoo and the olmec pieces are a great way to while away a few hours. The park surrounding the zoo was filled with families enjoying picnics. The observation tower is free and the climb is great, as is the view from the deck up top. When we were there in early May there were tons of pink blossomed trees all over Tabasco and in Villahermosa as well. From the park they lined the river and it was stunning. One does not have to look far to see the evidence of neglect in the park. It is a bit litter strewn and unkempt in places with accumulated vegetation. Main sidewalks are broken in places. It is not uncommon to see these things in Mexico, however this park deserves better from the city and or state.

202156876.name: A nice museum/zoo
202156876.author: a TripAdvisor user
202156876.reviewBody: The olmecs heads are a MUST SEE in Villahermosa. The history behind them are amazing and it is cheap to go... if you have student ID it is 10 pesos a ticket. WORTH IT ! \nThe zoo part of the park I didn\'t liked so much just because it seems like the animals are in a small place and I got the feeling that there were not properly being taken care of.... \nother than that... a nice place to visit.

202149070.name: Great afternoon stroll
202149070.author: a TripAdvisor user
202149070.reviewBody: Very well done for a small regional archeological park.  The museum is part archeological, part zoo animals.  If you\'re in Villahermosa for a couple of hours looking for something to do, make sure to pop in and take a stroll through.

191682364.name: Unexpectedly good combination of archeology and zoo
191682364.author: a TripAdvisor user
191682364.reviewBody: We arrived at  Villahermosa especially to be able to visit Parque-Museo La Venta, where many saved valuable exhibits of Olmec Culture,  brought from the archeological zone of La Venta located at the extreme North of Mexican Tabasco state, are exposed to the public. It is a kind of combination of open air Olmec sculpture museum and a zoo and a good combination. Despite the very bad weather and constant rain we stayed around two hours in the park and enjoyed both the archeological displays and live animals (some of them like coati are freely move along the park).\nWe can recommend visiting the park if it is on your route, of course, and if you are interested in getting acquainted with the remains of the Olmec civilization.

190209757.name: Villahermosa
190209757.author: a TripAdvisor user
190209757.reviewBody: So far as i can tell this is the only thing worth seeing in villahermosa. Its fairly priced and has a decent collection of mostly native animals. The highlight is the collection of Olmec art. The ancient stone heads and other carvings are very interesting, and you will see coatimundi and spider monkeys in the branches above you. Worth an hour or two.

186906799.name: Closed until mid-December
186906799.author: a TripAdvisor user
186906799.reviewBody: Agree with previous post. We were on there on November 27, 2013 and the park is definitely closed for renovation. \n\nAs an alternative, we went to the Carlos Pellicer Museum. It was newly renovated and it did have one giant Olmec head in the lobby and a collection of interesting Olmec and Mayan artifacts on 2 floors.

186681233.name: Not open still! Closed for renovations and no advertised info
186681233.author: a TripAdvisor user
186681233.reviewBody: We came to Villahermosa just for this park/museum.\nToday 2nd Dec we went there to find it was closed. Not sure where the person from the previous post went, but it\'s closed for 4 months until mid December.  Don\'t go until then. You can only see one Olmec from outside the gates.\nReally wish there was clearer info before we came here

185784446.name: Crocodiles, Turtles and Anteaters!!!
185784446.author: a TripAdvisor user
185784446.reviewBody: A lovely park with lots to see....and plenty of visitors. There is safety in numbers. Flora and fauna of Tabasco are all there. Lots of shade to keep things a tad cooler. Street artists, water and popcorn, local treats and souvenirs.

179661640.name: It is closed until december 2013
179661640.author: a TripAdvisor user
179661640.reviewBody: We didn\'t get a chance to go because it is under rehab but even the taxi driver didn\'t know! Very poor info from the taxi drivers! They told us it was closed since march until december 2013 utill we arrived to the box office! :(

177533174.name: a jungle park full of historic artifacts
177533174.author: a TripAdvisor user
177533174.reviewBody: a very lovey way to spend a morning or afternoon, the park also houses a small zoo of animals native to Tabasco, which is great in the jungle setting of the park. The Olmec stone pieces are fascinating.

174036614.name: Archeology will give you the " Big Head "
174036614.author: a TripAdvisor user
174036614.reviewBody: What a wonderful interactive and educational  museum/zoo park. We spent the day watching the animals of mexico, and learning about the Olmec culture and those huge head sculptures. There is a lot to see here and all of the exhibits are in English as well. This place is truly amazing. In addition to the wonderful bird house and reptile exhibit, there is a small pond area that had one of the largest crocodiles I have ever seen in my life. Well worth the visit.

173168647.name: Closed for 4 months
173168647.author: a TripAdvisor user
173168647.reviewBody:
Stupid mexican administration.
The museum is closed for four months!!! Event on the entrance door of the park it is not said "cerado'. Nothing in any web site of mexico!!
We came from france to visit the museum and the olmec sites; What a waist of money and time.
The same occurs two days ago for the museum of antropology of Merida. Closed; Even the lady of the tourist office in the gobiernor house tell us, the evening before, that the museum is open. In Merida it is not know :
-if it will reopen
-where are the collections
-what is inside the new museum of maya culture.
Don't loose your energy and money go to visit france or any 'developped country.

172439922.name: Needs a lot of improvment!
172439922.author: a TripAdvisor user
172439922.reviewBody: La venta is the most interesting place to visit although that doesn\'t mean it is very good note the heads are repilcars and the conditions for the animals makes one shed a tear. Villahermosa is a staging post for visiting some of the south of mexico\'s true treasures.

170968372.name: La Venta
170968372.author: a TripAdvisor user
170968372.reviewBody: It a nice open air museum, half archeological and half zoo, animals are clean but we were not able to see all of them.

167210327.name: Beautiful Park, but ... the Mosquitos!!!
167210327.author: a TripAdvisor user
167210327.reviewBody: This is really the only activity of note in Villahermosa for the casual visitor; the town itself is not all that captivating. What\'s nice about this park is that it\'s two things in one: a zoo and a look at some of the ancient Olmec artifacts from Tabasco. I\'ve heard rumor that some of these artifacts are replicas, but I cannot attest to the truth of that or not - all I can say is what I saw was quite stunning, if not a little too staged. It only takes a couple of hours, at most, to see all that La Venta has to offer, so I can think of no reason not to visit, but, oh! Those Mosquitos! They will eat you alive :)

165049372.name: Great for archeology lovers and pleasant for the entire family
165049372.author: a TripAdvisor user
165049372.reviewBody: This park shows the original stone figures of La Venta, one of the prime sites in the americqs and the  oldest of taht importance. \nIn is unusual n as far as the figures were not left "in situ" that is in there original place or taken to a museum. it si pleqsqnt for the entire family; as it is a short walk through a tropical Forest, with some local animals to be seen,

160486611.name: best thing in villahermosa, but still...
160486611.author: a TripAdvisor user
160486611.reviewBody: other are right - villahermosa is more of a staging ground than anything else. the park is fine. the curators basically created a zoo, and then decided to add a few olmec heads and other statuettes from neighboring archaeological sites they raided due (probably) to lack of tourism. which is fine in a museum sense, but they created these neatly manicured lanes to see the artifacts outside -- but there was no thought into the order, so everything appears placed haphazardly. and has little emotional response outside the context of where it was created.

156332664.name: Jewel of Villahermosa
156332664.author: a TripAdvisor user
156332664.reviewBody: The Parque Museo La Venta is the jewel of the City, a majestic park, with an archeological zone, Olmeca and Maya civilizations lived there thousands of years ago, and left many remains in the area. There is also a zoo, but the animals are in poor condition, as the park is state owned, and it is obvious that the entry fees do not cover operating costs, plus the money that is collected probably ends up in some park officials personal bank account.\nDefinitely visit if you are in Villahermosa.

154593951.name: About the only positive in this town
154593951.author: a TripAdvisor user
154593951.reviewBody: Town a real bust...nothing to do or see...big city tons of traffic 24/7. Anyplace better.  2 hours away a dont miss....Palenque

150446973.name: Worth a quick visit but I wouldn\'t go far out of my way
150446973.author: a TripAdvisor user
150446973.reviewBody: Being that this is an Olmec site and where the Olmec heads were found was interesting to me.  The structures (pyramid and other building sites) have not been excavated so other than seeing what an unexcavated site looks like, there isn\'t much to see.  To see the original heads, you will need to go to the museum in Villahermosa.  The museum at the La Venta  site has some artifiacts but nothing spectacular.   We had a quick visit and that was all that it took to see this archaelogical site.  If we missed this site, it wouldn\'t have been the end of the world.

150445078.name: Good place to go
150445078.author: a TripAdvisor user
150445078.reviewBody: I happened to have some time to klll and read that this was the best place to go.  I was not disappointed.  This outdoor "museum" holds replicas of figures found at an Olmeca sight in western Tabasco.  It is set up very well.  You enter the park through a zoo (which as everyone says - SKIP) and then you start to see the figures.  They are set up along a trail so you are winding through the park as you are looking at the figures.  It is very pleasant to walk through.  As you go, you will pass other animal exhibits which I mostly walked right by.  The museum gift shop is disappointing with very little to offer.  Outside, people sell more trinkets to take home (t-shirts for $2USD) and banana chips (which you should you try if you have not had them).

149066230.name: Nice park, but skip the zoo
149066230.author: a TripAdvisor user
149066230.reviewBody: La venta was all about the Olmecs for us. The zoo maybe okay for kids, but as an adult the small cages might not agree with you. The rest of the park is qute nice actually. You get to do a walking tour through a small but green park, visisting some of the exquiste statues of the olmecs. If you\'re staying around I would go!

148756490.name: Your kids will love it
148756490.author: a TripAdvisor user
148756490.reviewBody: If you are visiting Villahermosa with your kids, this park is an excellent option because is a mix of zoo and museum. The zoo is a little careless and the excessive use of bars does little to appreciate the animals.\nThe museum is a walk outdoors in the shown copies of the most important archaeological Olmecs made\u200b\u200b. The incredible thing is that while doing the tour, you can see many coatis that move freely among the people.\nThe biggest problem is the parking. While it is free, is excessively small, so that if you arrive early, it will be difficult to find free place.

146235500.name: Museum of Mexico\'s Cultura Maternal
146235500.author: a TripAdvisor user
146235500.reviewBody: Going to or from Palenque?  Stop here.  La Venta has artifacts from the Olmec culture, one of the oldest cultures of all of Mexico. Huge stone heads of mesoamerican ballplayers appear to be be portraits of individuals.  Check out the altars.  Many symbolized the union between man and jaguars that produced the legends of werejaguars.  This is a museum for serious students of Mesoamerica.  A must see.  A great way to spend a few hours in an open outdoor museum.

145422769.name: Nice Statues, Awful Zoo
145422769.author: a TripAdvisor user
145422769.reviewBody: Parque La Venta is worth a visit only if you are in Villahermosa and have time to kill. The zoo is awful with heavy fencing around most of the exhibits, many closed exhibits, and small pens for the animals. The basalt relics of the Olmecs are interesting, worth an hour or two The path to the outdoor statues exhibits is shady and the relics have good signage but for many you must have a good imagination to see what is in the stone. Cost was 40 pesos with free parking near museum. Only thing that disappointed me in 3 weeks in Yucatan.

142467904.name: A pleasant surprise
142467904.author: a TripAdvisor user
142467904.reviewBody:
We spent two nights in Villahermosa on our way through Mexico. We didn't really have plans for the day and heard about this park.

Since it was right across our Hotel, we chose to spend some hours at the park, but didn't expect much.
Well, we were pleasantly surprised. On the way to the park you'll pass a nice waterfront walk by a lake. There's some animals (kinda raccoons) roaming freely through that area and also through the park.

There's only a small entrance fee to the La Venta. There's a section with animals, actually a small zoo. They arranged it very nicely with some interesting animals. Then there's a path (almost jungle-like) which takes about an hour to walk. You'll pass lots of statues and archeological findings and learn some about the history of the Olmec. It's a nice walk, quiet and you even get some education.

Outside the park there's some vendors where you can get some souvenirs, clothes or food and drinks.
It's a nice place, a bunch of hours very well spent. So, if you're in town and have some time to spare, this is a great thing to do.

Wanna know more about my trips? Check my profile (where you'll also find my website with more info about my travels).

140261185.name: Was nice to visit
140261185.author: a TripAdvisor user
140261185.reviewBody:
it was an interesting place to walk through, but I would prefer to have there some excursions or more material to read/listen, to understand more about the place and cultural value.
There was a big cage with lots of huge parrots who were very friendly. :)
Also it was EXTREMELY HOT (in May), so we were dying during walking and found some place to rest in a souvenirs shop. There was an air conditioner. 
We heard about night lightning shows, but the day we arrived it was closed for it..

139439633.name: Great pieces, well laid out in a jungle atmosphere
139439633.author: a TripAdvisor user
139439633.reviewBody: A different concept to the usual museum and some great pieces, also includes a small zoo. Take insect repellent for mozzies and beware of the ants too.\nThe Lake of Illusions was delightful, lots of people walking and lovers enjoying time together.

137780231.name: YOU CAN\'T LEAVE VILLAHERMOSA WITHOUT VISIT IT
137780231.author: a TripAdvisor user
137780231.reviewBody: You need to be ready for mosquitoes and hot weather. But the place worth the time if you like walk, culture and art. The place has a zoo and a museum. The zoo is small but you can see some mexican species. The most incredible is the largest and old  (13.77 foot  and 76 years aprox  ) cocodrille I have seen. \nThe museum is also outdoor and they have some pieces from "La Venta" that are so popular. You will see  real pieces from Olmec culture like the Olmec Head.  \n

134950878.name: La venta
134950878.author: a TripAdvisor user
134950878.reviewBody: There really isn\'t a lot to do in Villahermosa, but if you visit the city don\'t miss going here.  The birds are amazing, and the olmeca museum is well worth walking around too

133718456.name: great experience
133718456.author: a TripAdvisor user
133718456.reviewBody: I like the distribution of the archaeological pieces and the explanation of every one. hire a guide is the option.

130090296.name: good idea
130090296.author: a TripAdvisor user
130090296.reviewBody: The oldest named people in mexico territory - Olmecs. Big monument for them. Very nice location a preserved artefacts for many years. Local living animals and birds around these place are supported good atmosphere.

129861556.name: Zoo
129861556.author: a TripAdvisor user
129861556.reviewBody: Signage was not well placed: once you start trip hard time finding exit. Bring plenty of water and good shoes. Very pretty surroundings. Hard time finding taxi.

128347250.name: The big heads
128347250.author: a TripAdvisor user
128347250.reviewBody: This was my only reason to come to Villahermosa and I truly enjoyed seening the Big Heads. It is the best part of the city to see.

126285396.name: Beautiful archaeological and cultural experience
126285396.author: a TripAdvisor user
126285396.reviewBody: The park is alongside the lagoon and features animal enclosures and information about the local fauna and flora.  A winding trail takes you through the jungle park and along the way, there are exhibits of Olmec sculptures found at the site of La Venta.  It was a magical way to spend the day! If I only had one day to spend in Villahermosa, the Parque Museo La Venta would be my first stop.

125468300.name: Well worth stopping
125468300.author: a TripAdvisor user
125468300.reviewBody:
This museum contains interesting original artifacts transported from the Olmec site of La Venta. (At La Venta, they have some replicas standing in place that look the same as what you see here). Curiously, even though these are original valuable artifacts, they stand out in the open air and are subject to erosion from wind and rain. 

There are some signs that explain a little bit of what you are looking at - there are some altars, stela (standing monuments) and some wonderful giant heads. The big heads make the visit worthwhile. Also, there are a few animals in a tiny zoo here - spider monkeys, black jaguar, spotted jaguar, ocelot, crocodiles. 

It wasn't crowded. I am glad that I saw it.

124488216.name: olmeca heritage
124488216.author: a TripAdvisor user
124488216.reviewBody: Beautiful place woth traveling to, a must to understand precolumbine civilizations.

124114959.name: Definitely worth your while.
124114959.author: a TripAdvisor user
124114959.reviewBody: This museum has one of the best collections of monumental Olmec art in Mexico.  The pieces are displayed along a walk through jungle vegetation.  However, the introductory/explanatory displays have not been maintained. We received a bonus in the form of a wandering family of coati whose path we kept crossing.  I have heard that there are plans to close this museum. I imagine they\'ll be moving the Olmec pieces indoors somewhere.

123763719.name: 7\'0 Head
123763719.author: a TripAdvisor user
123763719.reviewBody: Nice Parque with easy walking. Olmec sculpture scattered in easy viewing and photographing.

122919653.name: Amazing Olmec preserved history
122919653.author: a TripAdvisor user
122919653.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our time there and the boys loved it too.\nI wish we had more time to spend there. It is a zoo and the historic preserved park together that you have to pay an entrance fee. Out side of the zoo and historic park, there is a large public park where you can find locals pass time with family.

122794493.name: Very nice!
122794493.author: a TripAdvisor user
122794493.reviewBody: The zoo was basic, but pretty well done. The big aviary was especially nice, if you like parrots and such.\nWe got rained on the whole time, but that barely detracted from the wonderful experience of seeing all those world-famous and amazing original sculptures up-close and personal. \nThe park was very well-designed and a pleasure to traverse. The jungle foliage was really impressive, and the free-roaming coatis were fun to watch.

121784711.name: Very nice surprise!
121784711.author: a TripAdvisor user
121784711.reviewBody: I did not expect it, but La Venta is actually very entertaining park and definitely a reason to visit Villahermosa. Half zoo, half olmec museum, it is different than most archeological sites. Of-course, the biggest attraction were the freely walking coatis :) You will easily spend 2-3 hours there, kids will like it too.

116567425.name: Worth the trip
116567425.author: a TripAdvisor user
116567425.reviewBody:
I was traveling through Mexico during this time and was short on time when I decided to go to Villahermosa. This museum was really the only reason I decided to go there. It was well worth the trip!

The Olmec heads are quite impressive, and the way the park is setup within a park is quite unique and delightful. The weather was nice; and, though they gave me a slightly hard time for having a banana, I understood. Other than that, I found the workers there quite nice and actually had a conversation with one of the guys in the souvenir shop about new discoveries surrounding the Olmecs. 

Overall, dope experience!
